title: Will a significant political figure publicly endorse a theory related to string theory's implications for the universe by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant political figure publicly endorses a theory related to string theory's implications for the universe. A "significant political figure" is defined as a current or former head of state, government, or a member of the executive cabinet of a G20 nation. The endorsement must be explicit, relating directly to string theory's implications for the universe, and must be made in a public forum, such as an official speech, published article, or a verified social media post. The endorsement must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of ambiguous statements, the resolution will be based on the consensus interpretation by these reporting news organizations. This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such an endorsement.

title: Will a former or current NFL player run for a major political office in the United States by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a former or current player of the National Football League (NFL) has officially announced their candidacy for a major political office in the United States. For the purposes of this question, "major political office" is defined as a federal office (President, Vice-President, Senator, or Representative), a state governorship, or a mayoral position in a city with a population exceeding 300,000 according to the most recent U.S. Census data. The announcement must be confirmed through official campaign documentation or a public declaration by the candidate themselves. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Temporary or honorary positions, as well as non-elected roles, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major political agreement on climate change be reached at an international summit by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major political agreement on climate change is reached at an international summit. A "major political agreement" is defined as an agreement that includes specific, measurable, and time-bound commitments to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, adapt to climate impacts, or finance climate action, and is signed by at least 75% of the attending countries, including at least two of the following: China, the United States, the European Union, and India. The summit must be recognized by the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) or a similar authoritative body. The agreement must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or confirmed through official press releases by the participating countries or organizations. In the event that no such agreement is reached by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In case of agreements reached through virtual summits due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., global pandemic), these will be considered valid if they meet all other criteria.

title: Will Google face antitrust legislation in the United States before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, Google (or its parent company, Alphabet Inc.) is the subject of antitrust legislation passed by the United States Congress. The legislation must specifically address the company's market practices or dominance in the technology sector. For the purpose of this question, 'antitrust legislation' refers to any law or amendment designed to regulate or limit monopolistic practices, promote competition, or prevent the formation of monopolies or oligopolies in the technology industry. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. This question resolves as NO if no such legislation is passed by the specified date.

title: Will any G7 country approve a pharmacologically enhanced super-soldier program by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any G7 country (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States) has officially approved a military program aimed at pharmacologically enhancing soldiers to exceed normal human physical or cognitive capabilities. Approval must be confirmed through official government documentation or a public announcement by a relevant government authority. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient evidence. The program must aim for enhancements beyond current human limits, including but not limited to increased strength, speed, endurance, or cognitive abilities. Temporary or experimental programs, as well as those not aimed at enhancing capabilities beyond current human limits, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Taiwan hold a referendum on independence from China by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Taiwan has officially held a referendum on independence from China. The referendum must be sanctioned by the Taiwanese government and must specifically address the issue of Taiwan's independence from China. The outcome of the referendum does not affect the resolution of this question; it is the occurrence of the referendum itself that is relevant. Confirmation must come from official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the event. In the event of ambiguity regarding the referendum's focus on independence, the question will resolve based on the predominant interpretation in international media coverage.

title: Will any major legislation aimed at combating climate change be passed by the US House of Representatives before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the US House of Representatives passes any major legislation specifically aimed at combating climate change. For the purposes of this question, "major legislation" is defined as a bill that allocates at least $10 billion in funding towards climate change mitigation or adaptation efforts, introduces significant regulatory changes aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions, or establishes substantial new programs or initiatives for renewable energy development. The legislation must be passed by the US House of Representatives and must not solely be a resolution or declaration without binding legal effect. Confirmation of the passage of such legislation must come from official congressional records or statements. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. In the event that multiple pieces of legislation are passed, the question will resolve as Yes upon the passage of the first qualifying bill.

metadata.tags: Environmental Science, US House of Representatives

title: Will the percentage of US House of Representatives members publicly denying climate change decrease by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the percentage of members of the US House of Representatives who have publicly denied climate change decreases from the percentage recorded at the start of 2023.

Public denial of climate change is defined as any statement made by a sitting member of the US House of Representatives, in any official capacity or public forum, that explicitly rejects the scientific consensus on climate change. This includes denying the occurrence of climate change, its anthropogenic causes, or its scientifically established impacts.

The baseline percentage for comparison will be determined based on public statements made by members as of January 1, 2023. The resolution will be based on a comprehensive review of public records, official statements, and reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event that the number of seats in the House changes, the resolution will be based on the percentage, not the absolute number, of members denying climate change.

metadata.tags: Climate change denial, US House of Representatives

title: Will California pass significant new climate change legislation before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, California passes new legislation that significantly advances the state's climate change policies or goals. Significant legislation is defined as any law or set of laws that result in a measurable reduction in greenhouse gas emissions, promote substantial renewable energy development, or significantly enhance energy efficiency standards across any sector. The legislation must be passed by the California State Legislature and signed into law by the Governor. Confirmation of such legislation will be verified through official state government announcements or documentation. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (Los Angeles Times, San Francisco Chronicle, The New York Times, The Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Temporary measures or executive orders do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the NHL implement any new policies related to political endorsements or activities by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Hockey League (NHL) has officially implemented one or more new policies regarding political endorsements or activities by its players, teams, or associated personnel. 

New policies must specifically address the conduct of NHL personnel in relation to political endorsements, public political statements, or participation in political activities. The implementation of such policies must be confirmed through official NHL announcements or documentation. 

In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic, CBC Sports) will be considered sufficient for resolution. 

Temporary measures or statements of intent without formal policy adoption do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major breakthrough in artificial intelligence contribute to the understanding or exploration of black holes by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major breakthrough in artificial intelligence (AI) has significantly contributed to the understanding or exploration of black holes. A "major breakthrough" is defined as an AI-driven discovery or development that leads to a substantial advancement in black hole physics, such as providing new insights into their formation, structure, behavior, or the detection of previously unknown black holes. The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presentation at a major scientific conference. Additionally, the contribution of AI to the breakthrough must be explicitly acknowledged by the authors or the scientific community. In the absence of direct publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the breakthrough and its significance to black hole research will also be considered sufficient for resolution. The AI's role in the breakthrough must be substantial, going beyond mere data processing or visualization, and must be integral to the discovery or development itself.

title: Will artificial intelligence significantly reduce energy consumption in major industries by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a documented reduction of at least 20% in energy consumption in any of the following major industries due to the implementation of artificial intelligence technologies: manufacturing, agriculture, transportation, or energy production. The reduction must be compared to the documented energy consumption levels of the respective industry in 2020. Significant reduction in energy consumption must be confirmed by industry reports, government data, or credible research publications. In the absence of direct data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The use of AI must be directly attributed to the efficiency improvements and energy savings. Temporary or experimental implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Virginia Department of Health implement an AI-driven system to improve public health outcomes by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Virginia Department of Health has officially implemented an artificial intelligence (AI)-driven system designed to improve public health outcomes. The system must be operational and utilized in public health strategies, decision-making, or resource allocation. Implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Virginia Department of Health or documentation thereof. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The AI system must demonstrate a measurable improvement in public health outcomes, such as reduced disease transmission rates, improved vaccination coverage, or enhanced health service delivery efficiency, within one year of its implementation. If the system is in a pilot or trial phase as of December 31, 2025, the question will resolve as No unless there is clear evidence of a commitment to statewide implementation.

title: Will a major aerospace company announce a breakthrough in commercial space travel technology before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major aerospace company announces a breakthrough in commercial space travel technology. A "major aerospace company" is defined as a company with a significant presence in the aerospace industry, as recognized by the Aerospace Industries Association (AIA) or a similar authoritative body. A "breakthrough" refers to a technological development that significantly advances the capabilities, efficiency, safety, or cost-effectiveness of commercial space travel. The announcement must be verifiable through official company press releases or statements. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The technology must be demonstrably beyond the conceptual phase, with clear plans for implementation or testing.

title: Will Italy experience a GDP growth rate of over 2% in the year 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Italy's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate for the fiscal year 2024 exceeds 2%. The GDP growth rate is defined as the percentage increase in the value of all goods and services produced by the economy, compared to the previous year. The resolution will be based on data released by Italy's National Institute of Statistics (Istat) or, in its absence, the International Monetary Fund (IMF). In the event of discrepancies between these sources, the Istat data will take precedence. The resolution will consider the first official release of the data for the year 2024, without adjustments made in subsequent revisions.

title: Will a new major energy policy aimed at reducing carbon emissions be implemented in the US before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the United States officially implements a new major energy policy specifically aimed at reducing carbon emissions. A "major energy policy" is defined as a policy that has nationwide impact and is enacted by federal legislation, executive order, or through a significant regulatory change by a federal agency. The policy must explicitly aim to reduce carbon emissions by a quantifiable target or through significant regulatory measures. The implementation of the policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of a partial implementation or a policy that is phased in over time, the question will resolve as Yes if the initial phase of the policy has been officially implemented.

title: Will the United Kingdom face a significant territorial dispute affecting its international relations before 2030?
Will a major geopolitical event significantly impact the international soccer calendar before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major geopolitical event leads to the cancellation, postponement, or significant rescheduling of international soccer competitions (e.g., FIFA World Cup, UEFA European Championship, Copa América, AFC Asian Cup). A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that involves multiple countries and has widespread international implications, such as a war, significant political upheaval, or a global health crisis. The impact on the soccer calendar must be confirmed by official announcements from the governing bodies of the competitions (FIFA, UEFA, CONMEBOL, AFC) or reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of a dispute over what constitutes a "significant rescheduling," the decision will be based on whether the change affects the overall structure of the competition or the participation of multiple teams. Temporary changes or adjustments for individual matches do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new COVID-19 variant emerge that leads to global travel restrictions being reimposed before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a new variant of COVID-19 is identified that leads to the reimposition of global travel restrictions. For the purpose of this question, "global travel restrictions" are defined as travel bans or mandatory quarantines imposed by at least 50% of the countries in the United Nations. The variant must be officially recognized by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body in the field of infectious diseases. The reimposition of travel restrictions must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event that travel restrictions are imposed by a significant number of countries but do not reach the 50% threshold, the question will resolve as No. The resolution will consider only new variants that emerge and are officially recognized after the date of this question's posting.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency platform introduce a blockchain solution for tracking epidemic outbreaks by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major cryptocurrency platform has officially introduced a blockchain solution designed specifically for tracking epidemic outbreaks. A "major cryptocurrency platform" is defined as one that is among the top 10 by market capitalization according to CoinMarketCap at the time of the solution's announcement. The blockchain solution must be capable of tracking the spread of diseases, identifying hotspots, and potentially predicting future outbreaks with a focus on public health applications. The introduction of such a solution must be confirmed by an official announcement from the platform or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The solution must be operational and available for use, not merely in a developmental or trial phase. In the event of multiple platforms introducing similar solutions, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria.

title: Will California implement a state-wide digital currency regulated by its own blockchain by 2026?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, the state of California has officially implemented a state-wide digital currency that is regulated by its own blockchain technology. The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The digital currency must be operational and available for use by the general public within the state. It must be regulated by a blockchain technology that is either developed or sanctioned by the state government. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or for certain transactions), the question will resolve as Yes if the digital currency is intended for state-wide use. Pilot programs or trials do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant increase in voter turnout due to public health concerns in the next US presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the day after the next US presidential election, there is a reported increase in voter turnout of at least 10% compared to the previous US presidential election, attributed directly to public health concerns. The increase must be confirmed by official election results published by the Federal Election Commission (FEC). Public health concerns refer to issues such as pandemics, widespread diseases, or significant health crises that affect the general population. In the absence of direct attribution in FEC reports, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) that specifically cite public health concerns as a significant factor for the increased turnout will be sufficient for resolution. Temporary measures or changes in voting procedures solely due to public health concerns (e.g., expansion of mail-in voting, extended voting periods) that result in increased turnout will also be considered.

metadata.tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Will a former astronaut run for a congressional seat in the next US election cycle?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the end of the next US election cycle, a former astronaut officially announces their candidacy or is confirmed as a candidate for a congressional seat in either the House of Representatives or the Senate. The candidate must have completed at least one space mission as recognized by NASA or another internationally recognized space agency. Confirmation can come from official campaign announcements, filings with the Federal Election Commission, or coverage by at least two major news organizations (e.g., CNN, Fox News, The New York Times, The Washington Post). In the event of ambiguity regarding the candidate's astronaut status, the resolution will defer to the official NASA astronaut database or the equivalent database of the relevant space agency.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in quantum computing by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant breakthrough in quantum computing is announced. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as any of the following:
- The creation of a quantum computer that demonstrates quantum supremacy by solving a problem that is infeasible for classical computers within a reasonable timeframe.
- The successful implementation of a large-scale, error-corrected quantum computer with at least 100 qubits.
- The discovery or development of a new quantum algorithm that significantly reduces the complexity of solving a major problem compared to existing algorithms.

The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or announced at a major scientific conference. In the absence of direct publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient.

In the event of multiple breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of the criteria is met.

title: Will the United States government implement a major policy change regarding internet privacy before 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the United States government officially implements a major policy change regarding internet privacy. A "major policy change" is defined as any new federal law, executive order, or comprehensive regulatory framework that significantly alters the handling, protection, or surveillance of internet user data in a way that affects the general public or specific sectors significantly.

The policy change must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient.

For the purpose of this question, minor amendments to existing laws or policies, or changes that only affect government agencies without broader public impact, will not be considered as "major policy changes."

title: Will a new biotechnology emerge that significantly enhances computational bioinformatics by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new biotechnology has emerged that significantly enhances computational bioinformatics. Significant enhancement is defined as a technology that enables at least a 50% improvement in computational efficiency, accuracy, or data processing capabilities in the field of bioinformatics, as compared to the state of the art as of 2023. The emergence of such technology must be confirmed through publication in at least two peer-reviewed scientific journals in the fields of biotechnology or bioinformatics, or an official announcement from a recognized authority in the field (e.g., National Institutes of Health, European Molecular Biology Laboratory). Enhancements solely due to improvements in general-purpose computing hardware or software do not qualify. The technology must specifically address computational bioinformatics challenges. In the event of ambiguity, a consensus among experts in the field, as reported by reputable news sources or scientific publications, will be used to determine resolution.

title: Will Russia develop a quantum computer capable of breaking current encryption standards by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Russia has developed a quantum computer that is capable of breaking current encryption standards, including but not limited to RSA, ECC, and AES. The development must be confirmed by an official announcement from a recognized Russian government or scientific institution, or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The quantum computer must demonstrate the ability to decrypt data encrypted with current standards in a time frame significantly shorter than would be possible with classical computers. In the event of a dispute over the capabilities of the quantum computer, the resolution will be based on a consensus of expert opinion in the field of quantum computing.

title: Will France establish a national strategy for quantum computing research and development by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, France has officially announced and begun the implementation of a national strategy for quantum computing research and development. The strategy must be comprehensive, covering areas such as funding, infrastructure development, education, and international collaboration. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as a ministry or the office of the President. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Le Monde, Financial Times, New York Times) will be considered sufficient. The strategy must be aimed at advancing France's capabilities in quantum computing and must include specific goals or benchmarks to be achieved. Temporary or pilot programs do not meet the criteria for resolution.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) launch a public health database using blockchain technology by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has officially launched a public health database that utilizes blockchain technology. The database must be designed for public access and use blockchain technology to secure, store, or share data. The launch of such a database must be confirmed by an official CDC announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Reuters, The Washington Post) are sufficient. The database must be fully operational and accessible to the public, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial launch (e.g., limited to specific data sets or functionalities), the question will resolve as Yes if the database is intended for nationwide use and expansion. Temporary or pilot projects do not count towards this question's resolution.

metadata.tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Will Norway play a leading role in a major international peacekeeping initiative before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Norway has taken a leading role in a major international peacekeeping initiative. A "leading role" is defined as Norway being the primary initiator, coordinator, or contributor (in terms of resources or personnel) to a peacekeeping mission recognized by the United Nations or a similar authoritative international body. The initiative must be aimed at maintaining or restoring international peace and security, and must involve multiple countries. The recognition of Norway's leading role must be confirmed through official statements by the United Nations, the involved countries, or by coverage in at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of multiple initiatives, the question will resolve as Yes if Norway plays a leading role in any one of them.

title: Will Canada impose new sanctions on Russia before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, Canada officially imposes new sanctions on Russia. The sanctions must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The sanctions can be of any type, including but not limited to economic, diplomatic, or travel restrictions, and must be new or an extension of existing sanctions with significant changes. Temporary measures or statements of intent without formal implementation do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant shift in global power dynamics due to a major geopolitical event by 2030?
Will a significant discovery related to black holes contribute to a breakthrough in renewable energy sources by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery related to black holes leads directly to a breakthrough in renewable energy sources. A "significant discovery" refers to new, peer-reviewed scientific research that provides novel insights into the physics of black holes, which must be directly applicable to the development or improvement of renewable energy technologies. The breakthrough in renewable energy must be evidenced by the development of a new technology or a substantial improvement in the efficiency or cost-effectiveness of existing renewable energy sources. The connection between the black hole discovery and the renewable energy breakthrough must be clearly established in peer-reviewed scientific literature or recognized by a leading scientific organization. In the absence of direct scientific literature, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the breakthrough and its link to black hole research will suffice. The discovery and subsequent breakthrough must be publicly acknowledged by a reputable scientific body or consortium.

title: Will the Biden administration implement a new major policy on climate change before the end of its term?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 20, 2025, the Biden administration officially implements a new major policy on climate change. A "major policy" is defined as a policy that involves significant legislative action (e.g., a new bill passed by both houses of Congress and signed into law by the President) or a substantial executive order that has a nationwide impact on the United States' approach to climate change. The policy must be aimed at significantly reducing greenhouse gas emissions, promoting renewable energy sources, or enhancing climate resilience and adaptation strategies. The implementation of the policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. Temporary measures or policies with limited scope (e.g., specific to certain states or sectors) do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Israel achieve its goal of a 30% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Israel has officially achieved a 30% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions relative to its 2015 levels. The assessment must be based on data released by the Israeli government or an internationally recognized environmental monitoring organization. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The calculation of greenhouse gas emissions must include all major sectors (energy, industrial processes, agriculture, waste, land use, and forestry) and be consistent with international reporting standards, such as those of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). In the event of a dispute over the data or its interpretation, the question will resolve based on the consensus of scientific opinion as reported by reputable sources.

title: Will the United Kingdom commission a new nuclear power plant by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United Kingdom has officially commissioned a new nuclear power plant. Commissioning in this context means that the plant has been officially declared ready for operation by the relevant UK government authority or the operating company. The plant must be capable of generating nuclear energy for public or private use. The commissioning must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The plant must not only be commissioned but also operational, not merely in a planning or construction phase. In the event of a delay or cancellation, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US Congress pass legislation significantly impacting nuclear energy development by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the US Congress has passed legislation that significantly impacts the development of nuclear energy within the United States. Significant impact includes, but is not limited to, major funding initiatives, regulatory changes that facilitate or restrict nuclear energy development, or the establishment of new nuclear energy projects. The legislation must be signed into law by the President of the United States. Confirmation of such legislation must come from official government publications or statements. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. Temporary measures, such as executive orders or short-term funding allocations, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant nuclear technology breakthrough by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant breakthrough in nuclear technology is announced and recognized by the scientific community or a major nuclear energy organization (e.g., International Atomic Energy Agency, World Nuclear Association). A "significant breakthrough" is defined as any development that leads to a substantial increase in nuclear energy efficiency, safety, or waste reduction, or the successful demonstration of nuclear fusion as a viable energy source. The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference and verified by independent experts. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. This question resolves as YES upon official recognition of the breakthrough by a leading authority in the field. Otherwise, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will an NBA team break the single-season win record by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, an NBA team has officially broken the single-season win record. The current record, as of 2023, is 73 wins in a regular season, set by the Golden State Warriors in the 2015-2016 season. The record must be broken in a regular season that follows the standard 82-game format. Any changes to the season length or structure due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., strikes, pandemics) will not count towards this question's resolution. The NBA's official announcement or a confirmation from a reputable sports news source (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) is required for resolution. In the event of a tie, where multiple teams break the record in the same season, the question will still resolve as Yes.

title: Will a major sports league introduce a policy requiring performance-enhancing drug tests for all players by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any major sports league (defined as the National Basketball Association (NBA), Major League Baseball (MLB), National Football League (NFL), National Hockey League (NHL), or FIFA) officially introduces a policy that mandates performance-enhancing drug (PED) tests for all its players. The policy must require at least one unannounced PED test per player per season. Confirmation of such a policy must come from an official league announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient. Temporary measures or policies applying only to specific events or seasons do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the first commercial spaceflight with a professional athlete onboard occur by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a commercial spaceflight has successfully carried a professional athlete as a passenger. For the purposes of this question, a "professional athlete" is defined as an individual who is currently or has been previously employed by a professional sports team or has competed at a professional level in individual sports. The spaceflight must be operated by a commercial entity, not a government space agency, and must reach an altitude of at least 100 kilometers above Earth's surface, qualifying as a spaceflight according to the Fédération Aéronautique Internationale (FAI) standards. The athlete's participation must be confirmed by the commercial spaceflight company and verified through credible media reports from reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Google integrate a cryptocurrency payment system into its online services by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Google has officially integrated a cryptocurrency payment system into any of its online services, allowing users to make transactions using cryptocurrency. The integration must enable direct transactions for services such as Google Play, Google Cloud, YouTube, or any other online service provided by Google. The announcement of such integration must come directly from an official Google source or be confirmed through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The system must be fully operational and available to the general public, not in a beta or trial phase. In the event of a limited rollout (e.g., specific countries or services), the question will resolve as Yes if there is a clear plan for global expansion.

title: Will South Korea legalize the use of all major cryptocurrencies as legal payment methods by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, South Korea has officially legalized the use of all major cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple, Litecoin, and others as defined by market capitalization rankings on CoinMarketCap.com) as legal payment methods across the country. Legalization must be confirmed by an official government announcement or legislation passed by the National Assembly of South Korea. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The use of cryptocurrencies must be permitted in all types of transactions, without restrictions, across public and private sectors. In the event of partial legalization (e.g., limited to specific sectors or cryptocurrencies), the question will resolve as No unless all major cryptocurrencies are included.

title: Will there be a significant philosophical shift in international relations theory that influences global diplomacy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant philosophical shift in international relations theory that has been widely recognized and has influenced global diplomacy practices. A "significant philosophical shift" is defined as a new theory or substantial modification of existing theories that changes the approach to diplomacy, conflict resolution, or international cooperation, and is adopted or endorsed by at least three of the following entities: the United Nations, the European Union, the African Union, the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), or major nations (United States, China, Russia, India, Brazil). The shift must be documented in official statements, policy changes, or significant diplomatic actions that reflect the new theoretical approach. Recognition by reputable academic journals in the field of international relations or endorsements by recognized experts in international relations will also be considered. In the absence of direct evidence from the entities listed, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice. The question resolves as NO if such a shift is not recognized by the specified date.

title: Will a blog post by Scott Alexander spark a major geopolitical debate or policy change by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a blog post written by Scott Alexander has directly led to a major geopolitical debate or a significant policy change. A "major geopolitical debate" is defined as a discussion involving at least two countries on matters of international relations, security, or significant global issues, which is widely covered by reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). A "significant policy change" refers to a new law, regulation, or official policy enacted by a national government or a recognized international organization that can be directly attributed to the content of the blog post. The connection between the blog post and the debate or policy change must be explicitly acknowledged by at least three reputable news organizations or by official statements from the involved parties. Temporary or minor policy adjustments do not qualify. In the event of ambiguity, a consensus among credible sources will be sought to determine the outcome.

title: Will a major engineering breakthrough lead to a new form of international infrastructure project by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major engineering breakthrough has led to the initiation of a new form of international infrastructure project. A "major engineering breakthrough" is defined as a novel technological or methodological advancement in the field of engineering that significantly differs from existing practices and has the potential to fundamentally change the approach to infrastructure development. A "new form of international infrastructure project" refers to a project that involves the cooperation of at least two countries and introduces a new type of infrastructure that has not been previously implemented on an international scale. The project must be officially announced and underway, with clear evidence of international cooperation and funding. Confirmation must come from official government announcements or documentation from the countries involved. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The breakthrough and project must be distinct and not a continuation or minor modification of existing infrastructure projects.

title: Will a major space agency announce a significant advancement in quantum computing for space exploration before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major space agency (NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO, or JAXA) officially announces a significant advancement in quantum computing technology specifically designed for or applied to space exploration. Significant advancement refers to a breakthrough that enhances computational capabilities, efficiency, or problem-solving in space exploration tasks beyond the current state of the art. The announcement must be detailed in an official press release, documented in a peer-reviewed scientific publication, or reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the event of multiple announcements, the earliest will be considered. Advancements that are theoretical without practical application or deployment do not meet this criterion.

title: Will the United Nations establish a dedicated agency for space governance by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United Nations has officially established a dedicated agency for space governance. The agency must be recognized as a distinct entity within the UN system, with a mandate covering at least the regulation of space exploration, the use of outer space, and the management of space resources. The establishment of the agency must be confirmed by an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The agency must be operational, not merely proposed or in planning stages. In the event of a partial establishment (e.g., limited to specific aspects of space governance), the question will resolve as Yes if the entity is intended for full operational status within the UN system.

title: Will a space mission discover definitive evidence of extraterrestrial microbiology before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a space mission discovers definitive evidence of extraterrestrial microbiology. Definitive evidence includes, but is not limited to:

- Direct observation and analysis of microbial life forms that are conclusively determined to be of extraterrestrial origin.
- Unambiguous detection of biochemical markers or molecular signatures that can only be attributed to living processes, distinct from those on Earth.

The discovery must be confirmed through peer-reviewed scientific publication and recognized by a significant portion of the scientific community as valid evidence of extraterrestrial life. In the absence of a peer-reviewed publication, confirmation by at least two major space agencies (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA) is required.

In the event that evidence is found on a celestial body other than Mars, this question will still resolve as Yes, provided the evidence meets the above criteria.

title: Will Russia develop a quantum computer that surpasses the performance of current leading models by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Russia has developed a quantum computer that surpasses the performance of the current leading quantum computing models as of 2023. Performance must be validated through peer-reviewed scientific publications or official announcements from a recognized authority in quantum computing, such as the Quantum Computing Institute. Performance metrics include, but are not limited to, qubit count, coherence time, error rates, and computational benchmarks. The development must be confirmed by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or an official statement from a leading scientific organization. In the event of a dispute over the performance metrics, the consensus of the scientific community, as evidenced by publications in peer-reviewed journals or statements from recognized quantum computing bodies, will be considered final.

title: Will a significant discovery related to dark matter be made using computational models by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery related to dark matter is made using computational models. A "significant discovery" is defined as a finding that leads to a substantial advancement in our understanding of dark matter, such as providing evidence for its composition, properties, or distribution in the universe. The discovery must be confirmed through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and recognized by the scientific community as a major advancement. Computational models refer to simulations or analyses conducted using computer algorithms designed to predict or analyze astrophysical phenomena. The discovery must be attributed primarily to the use of these models. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Recognition by major scientific organizations (e.g., NASA, ESA, CERN) or a consensus in the scientific community is required for resolution. In the absence of such recognition, credible reports from at least three reputable science news outlets (e.g., Scientific American, Nature News, Science News) are sufficient.

title: Will an algorithm capable of accurately predicting NBA game outcomes be developed by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, an algorithm is developed that can predict the outcomes of NBA games with a minimum accuracy rate of 75% over a statistically significant sample size of at least one full NBA season (82 games per team). The algorithm must be publicly disclosed and its accuracy verified by independent statistical analysis. Verification must be published in a reputable scientific journal or presented at a recognized conference in the fields of sports analytics, statistics, or computer science. In the absence of such publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient. The algorithm must be operational and not in a theoretical or development phase. If multiple algorithms meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first to be verified.

title: Will Brazil implement a nationwide policy to achieve net-zero deforestation in the Amazon by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Brazil has officially implemented a nationwide policy aimed at achieving net-zero deforestation in the Amazon Rainforest. The policy must be enacted and in force, with clear mechanisms for enforcement and monitoring. It must aim to balance the amount of deforestation with afforestation or reforestation efforts within the Amazon region to achieve a net-zero deforestation rate.

The implementation of the policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary measures or policies with a focus outside the Amazon Rainforest do not count towards this question's resolution. The policy must specifically target the Amazon Rainforest and be intended for long-term implementation.

title: Will Israel achieve its goal of a 30% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Israel has officially achieved a 30% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions relative to its 2015 levels. The assessment must be based on data released by the Israeli government or an internationally recognized environmental monitoring organization. The calculation of the reduction will consider total national greenhouse gas emissions, including carbon dioxide, methane, nitrous oxide, and fluorinated gases, adjusted for any carbon offsets or credits. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the achievement are sufficient. This question resolves as YES upon official recognition of the achievement by the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) or a similar authoritative body. Otherwise, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in carbon capture technology by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant breakthrough in carbon capture technology is announced. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a development that results in a carbon capture technology that is at least 30% more efficient than the most efficient technology widely recognized as of 2023, in terms of the amount of CO2 captured per unit of energy expended or cost. The breakthrough must be validated by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official announcement from a major research institution or government body. In the absence of such publication or announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The technology must be proven to work at a scale beyond laboratory conditions, indicating potential for widespread application.

title: Will the United Nations adopt a new global policy on climate change by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Nations has officially adopted a new global policy on climate change. The policy must represent a significant update or addition to existing frameworks, such as the Paris Agreement, and must be aimed at further reducing global greenhouse gas emissions or addressing climate change adaptation measures. The adoption of the policy must be confirmed through an official UN press release or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be adopted by the UN General Assembly or an equivalent body with the authority to implement global climate policies. Temporary measures or statements of intent without formal adoption do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a groundbreaking study in social genetics significantly influence public policy by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a study in the field of social genetics has been published that significantly influences public policy in at least one country. The study must meet the following criteria:
- It must be peer-reviewed and published in a reputable scientific journal.
- The influence on public policy must be direct and significant, leading to the enactment of new laws, regulations, or significant changes in existing policies.
- The policy changes must be attributable to the findings of the study, as evidenced by official government statements, legislative texts, or credible news reports from reputable sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The study must focus on the genetic basis of social behaviors, traits, or predispositions and their implications for society.

In the absence of direct evidence linking the study to policy changes, a consensus among experts in the field, as reported by at least three reputable news organizations or academic publications, will be sufficient for resolution.

This question resolves as NO if these criteria are not met by the specified date.

title: Will Japan's population decline influence its economic policy significantly by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Japan has implemented significant changes in its economic policy directly attributed to its population decline. Significant changes include, but are not limited to, reforms in immigration policy to increase the workforce, adjustments in tax policies to encourage higher birth rates, or substantial increases in government spending on social services for the elderly. The changes must be officially announced by the Japanese government or documented in official government publications. In the absence of direct government announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the policy changes as a response to population decline will be sufficient. Temporary measures or policies not directly addressing the long-term implications of population decline do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major international sports event be hosted in Iran before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Iran officially hosts a major international sports event. A "major international sports event" is defined as any of the following:
- Olympic Games (Summer or Winter)
- FIFA World Cup
- FIBA Basketball World Cup
- Rugby World Cup
- ICC Cricket World Cup
- IAAF World Athletics Championships

The event must be recognized by the respective international governing body and must involve participation from at least 20 countries. The hosting of the event must be confirmed by the official announcement from the event's governing body or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event that Iran is announced as a host but the event is subsequently relocated or cancelled, the question will resolve as No. Temporary or exhibition events not under the auspices of the listed governing bodies do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major infectious disease outbreak lead to the cancellation of an international sports event by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major infectious disease outbreak results in the official cancellation of an international sports event. A "major infectious disease outbreak" is defined as an outbreak that is declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) by the World Health Organization (WHO) or results in over 1,000 confirmed deaths. An "international sports event" refers to any sporting competition that involves participants from at least three different countries and is recognized by an international sports federation. The cancellation must be directly attributed to the outbreak by the organizing body of the event. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary postponements or the cancellation of individual matches do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Scott Alexander announce a run for political office by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Scott Alexander (author of the blog Slate Star Codex and Astral Codex Ten) has officially announced his candidacy for any political office, either in a public statement, through his blog, or via a campaign launch. The announcement must be verifiable through reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Washington Post) or official campaign materials. Social media posts by Scott Alexander that explicitly announce his candidacy will also be considered valid. This question resolves as NO if no such announcement is made by the specified date.

title: Will SpaceX secure a government contract for a space-based defense system by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, SpaceX has secured at least one government contract for the development, deployment, or operation of a space-based defense system. The contract must be for a system intended to provide defense capabilities in space, such as satellite protection, missile tracking, or space debris management. The contract must be confirmed by an official announcement from SpaceX, the contracting government agency, or both. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Contracts for research, study, or technology development without a clear defense application do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a joint contract with other companies, the question resolves as Yes only if SpaceX is a primary contractor or has a major role in the project.

title: Will machine learning be utilized to predict election outcomes with over 90% accuracy in any G7 country by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a machine learning model has been utilized to predict the outcome of a national election in any G7 country (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, or the United States) with over 90% accuracy. The prediction must be for the overall election result, not individual constituencies or states. The accuracy is determined by comparing the predicted results with the official election results as announced by the national election authority of the respective country. The machine learning model's prediction must be publicly documented and verified by credible sources, such as major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) or academic publications. In the event of multiple models achieving this accuracy, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first verified instance. The use of machine learning models for predicting election outcomes in sub-national elections (e.g., state, provincial, or municipal elections) does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Republican Party launch a significant policy initiative related to technology before the 2024 elections?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Republican Party officially launches a significant policy initiative related to technology. A "significant policy initiative" is defined as a legislative proposal, executive action, or formal party platform amendment that aims to substantially alter federal or state technology policy, regulations, or funding levels in areas such as cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, data privacy, or digital infrastructure. The initiative must be publicly announced by a leading figure within the Republican Party or through official party channels. Confirmation from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) is required in the absence of a direct announcement. Temporary measures or minor adjustments to existing policies will not be considered significant for the purposes of this question.

title: Will a major technology company announce a breakthrough in renewable energy storage by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major technology company (defined as a company with a market capitalization of over $10 billion USD or equivalent at the time of the announcement) officially announces a breakthrough in renewable energy storage. The breakthrough must represent a significant advancement in energy storage technology, such as a substantial increase in storage capacity, a significant reduction in cost, or a major improvement in efficiency. The announcement must be verified through an official press release or public statement by the company. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The technology must be demonstrably beyond the conceptual stage, with clear plans for commercialization or implementation. In the event of multiple companies announcing similar breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of the announcements meets these criteria.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) introduce a new pandemic preparedness plan by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has officially introduced a new pandemic preparedness plan. The plan must be a comprehensive strategy addressing the prevention, detection, and response to future pandemics. It must be distinct from previous plans, incorporating new strategies or technologies not included in past versions. The introduction of the plan must be confirmed through an official CDC announcement or publication on the CDC website. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) will be considered sufficient for resolution. Temporary guidelines or updates to existing plans do not qualify as a new plan for the purposes of this question.

metadata.tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Will Norway implement a significant policy change in response to a global political event by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Norway has officially implemented a significant policy change in response to a global political event. A "significant policy change" is defined as a new law, regulation, or official government policy that represents a substantial shift from previous policies and has a wide-reaching impact on the country's governance, foreign relations, or economy. The global political event must be recognized as such by at least three major international news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, Reuters, The Guardian, Al Jazeera). The policy change must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations are sufficient. Temporary measures or responses that do not result in a lasting policy change do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the US Senate pass a major healthcare reform bill by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the US Senate has passed a bill that is widely recognized as a major healthcare reform. A "major healthcare reform" is defined as legislation that significantly alters the funding, delivery, or regulation of healthcare services in the United States. This may include, but is not limited to, changes in healthcare coverage, payment models, patient care standards, or access to healthcare services.

The passage of the bill must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient.

In the event that multiple bills are passed, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of the bills meets the criteria for a major healthcare reform. Temporary measures or executive orders do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Norway implement a new digital privacy law by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Norway has officially implemented a new digital privacy law. The law must specifically address the collection, storage, and processing of digital data by both public and private entities, and include provisions for the protection of individuals' privacy rights in the digital realm. Implementation is defined as the law being passed by Norway's parliament and receiving royal assent. Confirmation must come from an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event that multiple laws are passed, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one law meets these criteria. Temporary measures or amendments to existing laws do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major international court establish a precedent-setting case on AI ethics by 2027?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a major international court (such as the International Court of Justice, the European Court of Human Rights, or a similar recognized judicial body) has established a precedent-setting case related to artificial intelligence ethics. The case must explicitly address ethical considerations in the development, deployment, or use of AI technologies and must be recognized as setting a legal precedent in the field of AI ethics. The resolution will be based on official court documents or announcements. In the absence of such documents, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. The case must involve a decision that has implications beyond a single country, indicating its international significance. Temporary rulings or decisions that are not explicitly related to AI ethics do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major breakthrough in vaccine technology be announced by an aerospace company by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major breakthrough in vaccine technology is announced by an aerospace company. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly advances vaccine efficacy, delivery, or production, and is recognized as such by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body in the field of medicine. The announcement must be made through official channels of the aerospace company and must be corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The breakthrough must be in a stage where it is ready for clinical trials or beyond; early-stage research or theoretical advancements do not qualify. In the event that multiple aerospace companies announce relevant breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of the announcements meets all the specified criteria.

title: Will the NFL implement mandatory health screenings for players to detect early signs of pandemic-related illnesses by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Football League (NFL) has officially implemented mandatory health screenings for all players to detect early signs of pandemic-related illnesses. The screenings must be a part of the standard health protocols for players, either before the season starts or as a regular part of their health monitoring during the season. The implementation of such screenings must be confirmed by an official NFL announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient. The screenings must be designed to detect illnesses caused by pandemics declared by the World Health Organization (WHO) and must include, but are not limited to, testing for viruses that have caused global health emergencies. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific teams or during specific conditions), the question will resolve as Yes if the screenings are intended for league-wide application.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US utilize artificial intelligence to improve the efficiency of legal research by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Supreme Court of the United States has officially implemented an artificial intelligence system to assist in legal research tasks. The AI system must be acknowledged by an official Supreme Court announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, confirmation from at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) is required. The AI system must be actively used by the justices or clerks for legal research, and not merely in a trial or testing phase. The efficiency improvement must be documented through an official report or credible news sources, indicating a significant reduction in time spent on legal research compared to traditional methods.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration approve an AI-driven drug discovery platform by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has officially approved an AI-driven drug discovery platform. The platform must utilize artificial intelligence algorithms to identify, design, or optimize potential drug compounds. Approval must be for the platform's use in the drug discovery process, not merely for research or trial purposes. The approval must be documented through an official FDA announcement or publication. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Reuters, Bloomberg) are sufficient. The platform must be the first of its kind to receive such approval, distinguishing it from AI tools approved for other aspects of drug development or healthcare.

title: Will FIFA implement AI technology to enhance decision-making in football matches by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, FIFA has officially implemented artificial intelligence technology to assist or enhance decision-making in football matches. This includes, but is not limited to, real-time analysis for offside decisions, foul detection, and goal verification. The implementation must be recognized and confirmed through an official FIFA announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The technology must be in active use in official matches, not limited to trials or experimental phases. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific competitions or match situations), the question will resolve as Yes if the technology is intended for broader application within FIFA-regulated matches.

title: Will any Formula 1 event be officially endorsed or sponsored by a major political party or figure by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any Formula 1 event (including but not limited to races, qualifying sessions, and official testings) is officially endorsed or sponsored by a major political party or political figure. A "major political party" is defined as a political party that has representation in the national legislature of any country. A "major political figure" is defined as an individual holding or having held a significant public office (e.g., head of state, government minister) at the national level. Official endorsement or sponsorship must be confirmed through public announcements or documentation from either the political entity or Formula 1's governing body, the Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile (FIA). In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Temporary or informal support, as well as personal endorsements by political figures not acting in an official capacity, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will NASA announce a significant partnership with a political entity to promote STEM education in schools by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, NASA has officially announced a significant partnership with any political entity (e.g., a national government, state, or local government) aimed at promoting STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) education in schools.
