The partnership must be aimed at implementing or enhancing STEM education programs within schools and must be confirmed through an official NASA announcement or press release. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. The partnership must involve direct involvement or support from NASA in the form of resources, funding, or educational materials, and not merely an endorsement. In the event of multiple partnerships being announced, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Temporary or one-off events do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Elon Musk announce a candidacy for a political office in any country by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Elon Musk has officially announced his candidacy for any political office in any country. The announcement must be made directly by Elon Musk or through official channels associated with him (e.g., personal or company social media accounts, press releases). Verification will be based on reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Speculative or unofficial reports do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a retraction or clarification stating that Elon Musk is not seeking political office, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI-driven system be developed to predict outbreaks of infectious diseases with high accuracy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, an AI-driven system is developed and publicly acknowledged to predict outbreaks of infectious diseases with a demonstrated accuracy rate of at least 90% over a minimum period of one year. The system must be capable of predicting the outbreak of diseases that are infectious in nature, including but not limited to viruses, bacteria, and fungi, affecting humans. The prediction must include the timing, location, and scale of the outbreak. The development of such a system must be confirmed by an official announcement from a recognized health organization (e.g., World Health Organization, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or a reputable scientific publication. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational and available for use by health organizations or governments, not merely a prototype or in a trial phase. In the event of multiple systems meeting these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one system fulfills all the specified conditions.

title: Will an AI system capable of designing a Formula 1 car to win a world championship be created by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, an artificial intelligence (AI) system has been created and is capable of designing a Formula 1 car that wins a World Championship. The AI system must be the primary designer of the car, with its design decisions significantly contributing to the car's performance and competitiveness. The winning of a World Championship must be confirmed by the official Formula 1 organization. The AI's involvement and its role as the primary designer must be verified through official documentation or announcements from the team or Formula 1 organization. In the absence of direct confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The AI must be operational and its design must be implemented in a car that competes in and wins a World Championship race or series within the specified timeframe. Temporary or experimental uses of AI in design processes that do not result in a World Championship win do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used to predict the outcome of cricket matches with over 90% accuracy by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, an artificial intelligence system has been developed and is in use that can predict the outcome of cricket matches with over 90% accuracy. The AI system must have a publicly verifiable track record of predictions covering at least one full season of international cricket matches, including tests, one-day internationals (ODIs), and Twenty20 Internationals (T20Is). The accuracy rate must be confirmed by independent statistical analysis, and the results must be published in a reputable scientific or sports analytics journal. In the absence of such publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, ESPN, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The AI system must be recognized by a major cricketing body (e.g., International Cricket Council, Cricket Australia, England and Wales Cricket Board) as a tool for match prediction. Temporary or experimental uses of AI for match prediction do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant legal development in the understanding or application of string theory in the next decade?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2033, there is a significant legal development in the understanding or application of string theory. A "significant legal development" refers to any of the following:
- A major court ruling directly involving the principles of string theory in a case.
- The enactment of legislation or regulatory guidelines specifically addressing the application or implications of string theory in technology, research, or any other field.
- The establishment of a legal precedent that significantly impacts the interpretation, application, or understanding of string theory.

For the purpose of this question, "string theory" refers to the theoretical framework in physics that attempts to describe the fundamental forces and forms of matter in the universe through one-dimensional strings rather than particles.

The development must be documented and verified by reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or official government publications.

title: Will a new law mandating COVID-19 vaccination for international travelers be implemented in the US before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the United States enacts a federal law requiring COVID-19 vaccination for all international travelers entering or leaving the country. The law must apply to non-citizens and citizens alike, and must be in effect, not merely proposed or passed. Verification will be based on official announcements from the U.S. Department of State or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). In the absence of direct government announcements, confirmation from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Temporary measures or recommendations do not meet the criteria for resolution. In the event of a partial mandate (e.g., applicable only to travelers from certain countries), the question will resolve as No unless the mandate is explicitly intended to be expanded to all international travelers.

title: Will a landmark legal case involving a Major League Baseball player set a precedent for sports law within the next five years?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a legal case involving a Major League Baseball (MLB) player results in a court decision or settlement that is widely recognized as setting a new precedent in sports law. The case must involve issues unique to sports law, such as player contracts, doping regulations, or the legal implications of technological advancements in sports. The precedent-setting nature of the case must be acknowledged by at least three reputable legal analysis platforms or publications (e.g., LexisNexis, Westlaw, The American Lawyer). In the event that multiple cases could qualify, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets these criteria. Cases that only reaffirm existing precedents or are limited in scope to individual circumstances without broader legal implications will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will FIFA implement a new global regulation for player transfers that significantly impacts soccer law by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, FIFA has officially implemented a new regulation for player transfers that significantly impacts soccer law globally. The regulation must introduce changes that affect the transfer processes, player contracts, or transfer fees in a manner that is widely recognized as significant by the soccer community. The implementation of such a regulation must be confirmed by an official FIFA announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, BBC Sport, Sky Sports, or similar) are sufficient. The regulation must be in effect, not proposed or in a trial phase. Changes that are purely administrative or minor adjustments to existing regulations do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a dispute over the significance of the regulation, the question will resolve based on the consensus of legal experts in sports law.

title: Will a major environmental law aimed at reducing carbon emissions be passed in the European Union by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the European Union has officially passed a major environmental law aimed at significantly reducing carbon emissions across its member states. A "major environmental law" is defined as legislation that sets binding carbon emission reduction targets for the EU as a whole or for individual member states that collectively represent at least 50% of the EU's total carbon emissions. The law must include specific measures and timelines for achieving these targets. The passage of such a law must be confirmed by an official EU announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The law must be fully ratified and come into effect, not merely proposed or in the drafting stage. Interim measures or resolutions without binding targets do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the NBA face a significant legal challenge regarding player contracts or free agency rules by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Basketball Association (NBA) faces a legal challenge that is deemed significant regarding its player contracts or free agency rules. A legal challenge is considered significant if it involves a lawsuit filed by one or more current or former NBA players, a players' association, or any other entity that has the potential to result in a change to the NBA's existing contracts or free agency rules. The challenge must be recognized by a federal or state court in the United States. Confirmation of such a legal challenge must come from official court documents or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, The New York Times, The Washington Post). In the event of multiple challenges, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one challenge meets these criteria. Temporary injunctions or rulings that do not have the potential to result in permanent changes to the NBA's policies do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will renewable energy sources account for more than 50% of global energy production by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, renewable energy sources (including wind, solar, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass) account for more than 50% of global energy production. The assessment will be based on the official global energy statistics published by the International Energy Agency (IEA) or another comparable authoritative global energy organization. In the absence of a clear statement from such organizations, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. For the purpose of this question, "global energy production" refers to the total energy output from all sources worldwide, and "renewable energy sources" include those that are naturally replenished on a human timescale such as wind, solar, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass. Energy production from nuclear sources is not considered renewable for this question.

title: Will the global average temperature increase by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels before 2050?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2050, the global average temperature is confirmed to have increased by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels (defined as the average global temperature from 1850-1900). The assessment must be based on the annual average global surface temperature data as reported by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or another authoritative scientific body that is recognized by the scientific community. In the event that the IPCC or equivalent body revises its methodology for measuring global average temperature, the revised methodology will be used for this question's resolution. If no such data is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a significant breakthrough in bioengineering contribute to carbon capture technology by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant breakthrough in bioengineering has been achieved that contributes to carbon capture technology. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a development that results in a demonstrable increase in the efficiency or cost-effectiveness of carbon capture by at least 20%, compared to the state of the art as of 2023. The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or confirmed by a major scientific organization (e.g., National Academy of Sciences, Royal Society). Developments that only have a theoretical impact without practical application or deployment do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of multiple claims of breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one is widely recognized by the scientific community and verified by independent experts.

title: Will there be a significant technological advancement in election security technology before the 2024 US presidential election?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before November 3, 2024, a significant technological advancement in election security technology is announced and implemented in the United States that meets the following criteria:
- The technology must enhance the security of the voting process, ensuring the integrity and confidentiality of votes.
- The advancement must be widely recognized by election security experts and must have been adopted or be in the process of adoption by at least one state in the United States for the 2024 presidential election.
- The technology must be a novel approach or a significant improvement over existing technologies in terms of preventing, detecting, or responding to cyber threats and vulnerabilities.

The announcement of such technology must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient.

In the event that multiple technologies are announced, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria.

title: Will Google launch a new AI-driven search algorithm that significantly improves search accuracy by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Google has officially launched a new search algorithm that utilizes artificial intelligence to significantly improve search accuracy. The improvement in search accuracy must be quantifiable, with a minimum improvement of 20% over the current model's performance in terms of relevance and precision of search results, as measured by a recognized industry standard or benchmark. The launch of the new algorithm must be confirmed by an official announcement from Google. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The algorithm must be fully deployed and operational, not in a trial phase. Improvements attributed to updates of existing algorithms without a significant AI-driven overhaul do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will OpenAI release a groundbreaking AI model that surpasses human intelligence in general problem solving by 2027?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, OpenAI has officially released an artificial intelligence model that surpasses human intelligence in general problem solving across a wide range of domains, including but not limited to, natural language understanding, logical reasoning, and creative thinking. The AI model must demonstrate the ability to perform tasks and solve problems at a level that exceeds the capabilities of the best human experts in those fields. The release of such a model must be confirmed by an official announcement from OpenAI. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. Additionally, the model's capabilities must be independently verified by at least two reputable scientific or technological institutions. The AI model must be publicly available, not limited to internal use or specific partnerships. In the event of a dispute over the model's capabilities, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the scientific community.

title: Will NASA announce a significant political partnership for space exploration before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, NASA announces a significant political partnership for space exploration. A "significant political partnership" is defined as a formal agreement between NASA and one or more national governments or international organizations, aimed at collaborative efforts in space exploration missions, research, or development. The partnership must be new or a substantial expansion of existing collaborations, with clear objectives for joint space exploration activities. The announcement must be made through official NASA channels or confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Reuters). In the event of ambiguous announcements, the question will resolve as Yes only if the partnership involves concrete, planned space exploration missions or projects with specified roles for each party. Temporary agreements or partnerships solely for consultation do not meet the criteria for resolution.

title: Will a major political figure endorse quantum computing as a national priority before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major political figure publicly endorses quantum computing as a national priority. A "major political figure" is defined as a current head of state, head of government, or a cabinet-level official in any of the G7 countries (United States, United Kingdom, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan). The endorsement must be explicit, calling for increased investment, research, development, or deployment of quantum computing technologies. The endorsement must be verifiable through official statements, speeches, policy documents, or credible news reports from reputable sources such as BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, or Reuters. In the event of ambiguous statements, the resolution will consider the context and intent to determine if quantum computing is being prioritized as a national agenda. If multiple endorsements occur, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first verifiable instance.

title: Will FIFA's decision on hosting the World Cup lead to a diplomatic incident before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, FIFA's decision on the host country for any upcoming World Cup leads directly to a diplomatic incident. A "diplomatic incident" is defined as a situation where formal diplomatic relations are significantly disrupted between nations, including but not limited to public disputes, withdrawal of ambassadors, imposition of sanctions, or official complaints lodged at international bodies such as the United Nations. The incident must be directly attributable to FIFA's decision on the World Cup host country and must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of ambiguous situations, a consensus among these reports will be required for resolution. Temporary disputes resolved within 30 days do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a former astronaut run for a US Senate seat in the next election cycle?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the end of the next US Senate election cycle, a former astronaut officially announces their candidacy or is confirmed as a candidate for a US Senate seat. A "former astronaut" is defined as someone who has completed at least one spaceflight as recognized by NASA or an equivalent international space agency. The candidacy must be for a seat in the United States Senate, and the individual must be recognized as a candidate by a major political party or have significant independent or third-party backing. Confirmation can come from official campaign announcements, FEC filings, or credible news reports from reputable sources such as BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post, or The Guardian. In the event that multiple former astronauts run, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first official announcement. If no former astronaut has announced their candidacy by the end of the election cycle, the question resolves as No.

title: Will Donald Trump announce a new space policy initiative before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, Donald Trump, either as President of the United States, a private citizen, or in any other capacity, officially announces a new space policy initiative. The announcement must be specific to space exploration, development, or policy, and must represent a new proposal or a significant amendment to existing policies. The announcement must be verifiable through official channels (e.g., official government press releases, Donald Trump's verified social media accounts) or reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the consensus of coverage by the specified news organizations. If no announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report an increase in employment within the aerospace sector by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports an increase in employment within the aerospace sector compared to its last report prior to 2025. The increase must be reflected in the official BLS employment statistics for the aerospace sector, which includes jobs related to the manufacture, design, and maintenance of aircraft and spacecraft. The resolution will be based on the annual summary report or the quarterly reports if the annual summary is not available by the resolution date. In the event that the BLS discontinues its reporting on the aerospace sector, or if there is a significant change in the methodology that prevents a direct comparison with previous reports, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

title: Will Virginia introduce state-specific regulations for cryptocurrency exchanges by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the state of Virginia has officially introduced regulations specific to cryptocurrency exchanges operating within its jurisdiction. The regulations must be enacted into law, either through legislative action or executive order, and must specifically address the operation, security, consumer protection, or taxation of cryptocurrency exchanges. The introduction of regulations must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., The Washington Post, The New York Times, Reuters, Bloomberg) are sufficient. Regulations that are proposed but not enacted, or general financial regulations not specifically targeting cryptocurrency exchanges, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency platform introduce a feature to offset its carbon footprint in response to climate change concerns by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major cryptocurrency platform (defined as one with a daily transaction volume exceeding $1 billion USD or serving over 1 million active users monthly) officially introduces a feature or program specifically designed to offset its carbon footprint in response to climate change concerns. The feature must directly address the platform's carbon emissions, such as through carbon offset purchases, renewable energy investments, or technology upgrades aimed at reducing energy consumption. The introduction of the feature must be confirmed by an official announcement from the platform or credible documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The feature must be operational, not merely proposed or in a trial phase. Temporary initiatives or those not directly related to the platform's operations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new cryptocurrency be developed that utilizes machine learning for enhanced security by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new cryptocurrency has been developed that utilizes machine learning algorithms as a core component of its security features. The cryptocurrency must be publicly launched and available for use, with its security features clearly documented and verified by credible cybersecurity experts or institutions. The use of machine learning must significantly enhance the security of the cryptocurrency compared to existing technologies, as evidenced by peer-reviewed research, patents, or public documentation. The development and launch of the cryptocurrency must be confirmed by credible sources, such as major technology news outlets (e.g., TechCrunch, Wired, The Verge) or official announcements from the development team. In the event of multiple cryptocurrencies meeting these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of them is recognized by a major cryptocurrency exchange or financial institution as having enhanced security due to machine learning.

title: Will Brazil launch a manned mission to the Moon before 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2040, Brazil has successfully launched a manned mission to the Moon. The mission must be officially recognized and confirmed by the Brazilian Space Agency (Agência Espacial Brasileira - AEB) or another official government body. The mission must involve at least one Brazilian astronaut landing on the Moon and safely returning to Earth. In the event of a collaborative mission with other countries or private entities, the mission will still resolve as Yes if Brazil is a leading partner and contributes significantly to the mission's execution. Confirmation of the mission's success must come from official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary or unmanned missions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new international space treaty involving the United States be proposed in response to statements made by Donald Trump by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new international space treaty involving the United States is proposed specifically in response to statements made by Donald Trump. The proposal of such a treaty must be officially announced by either a U.S. government entity, the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA), or any other recognized international space governance body. The treaty must aim to address or counteract the implications of Trump's statements regarding space policy, exploration, or security. Verification of the treaty's proposal in response to Trump's statements must be supported by official documentation or announcements. In the absence of direct official announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The treaty does not need to be ratified by the resolution date to meet this criterion.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to significant disruptions in international space collaborations by 2025?
Will North Korea amend its constitution to incorporate more stringent laws on digital information control by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, North Korea has officially amended its constitution to incorporate more stringent laws on digital information control. The amendment must specifically enhance the government's ability to monitor, regulate, or restrict digital information, including but not limited to internet access, social media, and digital communications. The amendment must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The laws must be in effect, not merely proposed or in a trial phase. In the event of ambiguous reports or lack of clarity, the question will resolve as No until unambiguous confirmation is obtained.

title: Will a major international legal body introduce COVID-19 specific regulations that impact global travel by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major international legal body (such as the United Nations, World Health Organization, International Civil Aviation Organization, or a similar entity) officially introduces regulations specifically addressing COVID-19 that significantly impact global travel. Significant impact includes, but is not limited to, mandatory vaccinations, testing requirements, travel bans, or quarantine mandates for international travelers. The introduction of such regulations must be confirmed through official publications or press releases by the respective legal body. In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. Temporary measures or recommendations without legal enforcement do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant legal reform in international law to address the spread of infectious diseases by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant legal reform in international law specifically aimed at addressing the spread of infectious diseases is adopted. 

Significant legal reform refers to the establishment or amendment of international agreements, treaties, or conventions that introduce new measures, standards, or protocols for the prevention, monitoring, or control of infectious diseases on a global scale. 
The reform must be ratified or officially adopted by at least 50% of the member states of the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar proportion of United Nations member states. 

The adoption of the reform must be confirmed through official documentation or announcements by the WHO, the United Nations, or the respective legal bodies involved in the reform. 

In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient for resolution. 

Temporary measures or resolutions that do not result in permanent legal changes do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a Major League Baseball team publicly endorse a candidate in the next US presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 3, 2024, any Major League Baseball (MLB) team has officially endorsed a candidate for the next US presidential election. An official endorsement is defined as a public statement or announcement made by the MLB team's official communication channels (e.g., official website, press release, verified social media accounts) or by an authorized spokesperson of the team, explicitly supporting a specific presidential candidate. Endorsements made by individual team members, including players, coaches, or executives, in a personal capacity do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of conflicting reports or statements, the most recent official statement will be considered definitive. The endorsement must be clear, unambiguous, and specifically related to the presidential election. In the absence of such an endorsement, this question resolves as No.

title: Will Tesla announce support for a specific political party in the next US federal election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Tesla, Inc. has officially announced support for a specific political party in the context of the next United States federal election. The announcement must be made through an official Tesla communication channel, such as a press release, official social media account, or statement from a company executive authorized to speak on behalf of Tesla. Support can be in the form of an endorsement, financial contribution, or any other public declaration of support for the party. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the support will be sufficient for resolution. This question resolves as NO if no such announcement or credible confirmation is made by the specified date.

title: Will quantum computing technology be used to significantly enhance space exploration missions by 2030?
Will there be a new philosophical theory widely accepted by the scientific community that redefines our understanding of space by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new philosophical theory that redefines our understanding of space is widely accepted by the scientific community. For the purpose of this question, "widely accepted" means that the theory is endorsed or acknowledged positively by at least three leading scientific organizations or by publications in at least three peer-reviewed journals in the fields of physics, astronomy, or philosophy of science. The theory must propose a novel understanding or conceptual framework of space that significantly diverges from or adds to existing theories. Acceptance by the scientific community can be demonstrated through citations, public endorsements, or inclusion in academic curricula. In the absence of such endorsements, widespread discussion and positive reception in reputable scientific forums or conferences may also be considered. The theory must be clearly defined and distinguishable from existing theories at the time of its proposal. In the event of multiple competing theories, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets these criteria.

title: Will a new space mission be named after a famous baseball player by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new space mission is officially named after a famous baseball player. The mission can be initiated by any government space agency, private space company, or international space collaboration. The baseball player must have been inducted into the National Baseball Hall of Fame or recognized with a major award (e.g., MVP, Cy Young Award) in their career. The naming must be confirmed through official announcements or press releases by the responsible space organization. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The mission must be intended for launch, not merely proposed or in planning stages. In the event of multiple missions being named after baseball players, the question resolves as Yes upon the first official announcement.

title: Will Major League Baseball (MLB) influence any significant political decisions or policies in the United States by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Major League Baseball (MLB) has been confirmed to directly influence one or more significant political decisions or policies in the United States. Significant influence is defined as MLB's direct involvement in the drafting, lobbying for, or public campaigning of a political decision or policy that is subsequently adopted or significantly altered at the federal, state, or local level. Confirmation must come from official statements by MLB, government records, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). Influences related to sports betting, player health and safety regulations, and stadium financing or development are considered within scope. Influences that are indirect or cannot be clearly attributed to MLB's efforts will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will OpenAI develop a technology that significantly impacts election security or political campaigning by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, OpenAI has developed and publicly announced a technology that significantly impacts election security or political campaigning. Significant impact is defined as:
- A technology that is adopted by at least one national government or major political party in any country for the purpose of enhancing election security, preventing misinformation, or optimizing campaign strategies.
- A technology that has been the subject of analysis or reporting by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) for its potential or actual impact on election security or political campaigning.

The technology must be a new development or a significant improvement on existing technologies, and its impact must be clearly documented. In the absence of a public announcement by OpenAI, credible reports from major news organizations or official government statements are sufficient for resolution.

In the event that multiple technologies are developed, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets the above criteria.

title: Will a major political scandal involving information technology emerge in a G20 country by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major political scandal involving information technology emerges in any of the G20 countries. A "major political scandal" is defined as an event that involves the misuse of information technology (e.g., hacking, unauthorized surveillance, data manipulation) by or against a government official or agency, which results in significant public outcry, legal or legislative action, or changes in policy. The scandal must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) and involve a clear breach of law or ethical standards. The involvement of information technology must be central to the scandal, not peripheral. In the event of multiple qualifying scandals, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first such scandal being reported. Temporary or minor controversies that do not lead to significant consequences as described above do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major scientific study in 2025 reveal that playing soccer significantly affects cognitive functions?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major scientific study is published that reveals playing soccer has a significant effect on cognitive functions. For the purposes of this question, a "major scientific study" is defined as a study that meets all of the following criteria:
- It is published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal with an impact factor of 5 or higher.
- The study involves a sample size of at least 1,000 participants.
- The study's findings are reported on by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

"Significant effect on cognitive functions" must be quantitatively measured, demonstrating a clear statistical difference in cognitive performance between soccer players and a control group. The study must explicitly attribute these differences to playing soccer, ruling out other potential confounding factors.

In the event that multiple studies are published, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. If no study meets these criteria by the specified date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will the Large Hadron Collider discover a new fundamental particle by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) has officially announced the discovery of a new fundamental particle not currently included in the Standard Model of particle physics. The discovery must be confirmed through peer-reviewed research published in a reputable scientific journal and recognized by the scientific community. The announcement must come directly from CERN or be published in collaboration with CERN researchers. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first confirmed discovery. Discoveries announced but not confirmed by peer review by the resolution date will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will France lead a groundbreaking international environmental science project by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, France has initiated or taken a leading role in an international environmental science project that is recognized as groundbreaking. A project will be considered "groundbreaking" if it introduces novel technologies, methodologies, or significant advancements in environmental science. The project must involve collaboration between France and at least two other countries. The leadership role of France must be acknowledged through official documentation or public announcements by the participating countries or leading international environmental organizations. In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. The project must be beyond the planning stage and have commenced actual research or implementation activities. Temporary or pilot projects are included if they have a clear path to broader application or impact. Projects that are solely funding or hosting conferences without direct research or implementation activities do not qualify.

title: Will the US Senate pass a major climate change legislation before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the US Senate passes a major piece of legislation specifically aimed at addressing climate change. For the purposes of this question, "major" legislation is defined as a bill that allocates at least $100 billion towards climate change mitigation, adaptation, or research efforts over a ten-year period. The legislation must be signed into law by the President of the United States to count towards this question's resolution. Confirmation of the bill's passage and signing must come from official government sources or be reported by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the event that multiple pieces of legislation are passed, the question will resolve as Yes if any single bill meets the above criteria. Temporary measures, executive orders, or smaller-scale funding initiatives do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a current or former NHL player run for a political office in the US before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, any current or former National Hockey League (NHL) player officially announces their candidacy or is confirmed to be running for any political office within the United States. The political office in question must be a publicly elected position at any level of government (federal, state, or local). Confirmation can come from an official campaign announcement by the player or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post, CNN). In the event that multiple players announce their candidacy or are confirmed to be running, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first such announcement. If no such announcements are made or confirmed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Google's influence on political advertising regulations increase significantly by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is significant evidence that Google's influence on political advertising regulations has increased. Significant influence is defined as Google playing a direct role in the creation, amendment, or enforcement of laws or regulations governing political advertising in at least one G7 country. Evidence may include, but is not limited to, official government announcements, legislative records, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the case of indirect influence, such as through lobbying efforts or partnerships with regulatory bodies, the question will resolve as Yes only if these efforts result in tangible changes to political advertising regulations. The resolution will consider both digital and non-digital advertising platforms. In the absence of clear evidence, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency platform introduce a blockchain solution for environmental sustainability tracking by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major cryptocurrency platform has officially introduced a blockchain solution specifically designed for environmental sustainability tracking. The solution must be aimed at tracking carbon emissions, renewable energy usage, or other environmental sustainability metrics. The introduction of such a solution must be confirmed by an official announcement from the platform or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The platform is considered "major" if it is among the top 10 by trading volume according to CoinMarketCap or a similar authoritative source at the time of the announcement. In the event of multiple platforms introducing similar solutions, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first verified announcement. Solutions that are in a pilot or trial phase by the resolution date do not count.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be created specifically to support victims of the Russo-Ukrainian War by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a cryptocurrency has been created with the specific purpose of supporting victims of the Russo-Ukrainian War. The cryptocurrency must be designed to directly benefit either individuals affected by the conflict or organizations working on their behalf. The creation of the cryptocurrency must be verified through an official announcement by the development team or organization behind it, or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The cryptocurrency must be publicly available and operational, not merely proposed or in development. In the event of multiple cryptocurrencies being created for this purpose, the question will resolve as Yes upon the launch of the first such cryptocurrency.

title: Will Sweden launch its own state-backed cryptocurrency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Sweden has officially launched a state-backed cryptocurrency. The cryptocurrency must be recognized and regulated by the Swedish government, and available for use by the general public for transactions within and possibly outside of Sweden. The launch of such a cryptocurrency must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be operational, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial launch (e.g., limited to specific regions or for specific uses), the question will resolve as Yes if the cryptocurrency is intended for nationwide use.

title: Will there be a significant impact on voter turnout in the next US presidential election due to a major microbiological discovery or outbreak?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the day after the next US presidential election, there is a significant impact on voter turnout attributed directly to a major microbiological discovery or outbreak. A "significant impact" is defined as a change of 5% or more in voter turnout compared to the previous US presidential election, as reported by the Federal Election Commission. A "major microbiological discovery or outbreak" refers to a discovery or outbreak that is widely reported by reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) and recognized by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) or the World Health Organization (WHO). The impact must be explicitly linked to the discovery or outbreak by credible sources. In the absence of direct attribution, a consensus among at least three reputable news organizations that the discovery or outbreak had a significant impact on voter turnout will suffice. This question resolves as NO in the absence of such evidence.

title: Will advancements in biotechnology lead to a notable change in election security or voting processes by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, advancements in biotechnology have led to a notable change in election security or voting processes. Notable changes include, but are not limited to:
- The implementation of biometric verification systems (e.g., fingerprint, facial recognition, DNA matching) as a standard procedure in voter identification or authentication in at least one G7 country.
- The use of genetically personalized security features (e.g., DNA-based ink in ballots) to prevent fraud or enhance voter authentication.
- The adoption of biologically-derived cybersecurity measures in electronic voting systems to protect against hacking or unauthorized access.

A change is considered "notable" if it is officially adopted by national election authorities or legislated by the national government and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of such adoption or legislation, widespread use in multiple jurisdictions within a G7 country may also qualify.

In the event of ambiguous developments, the resolution will defer to the consensus of experts in the fields of biotechnology and election security, as reported by reputable sources.

title: Will a major tennis event influence voter turnout or political endorsements in any country's national election before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major tennis event (defined as one of the Grand Slam tournaments: Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, or US Open) directly influences voter turnout or political endorsements in any country's national election. Influence on voter turnout must be evidenced by a statistically significant change attributed to the event by reputable polling organizations or academic studies. Influence on political endorsements must be explicitly stated by the endorsing party or individual as being influenced by the event. Verification will rely on reports from reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or peer-reviewed academic publications. In the absence of direct evidence, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will North Korea conduct a new nuclear test before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, North Korea conducts a new nuclear test. A "nuclear test" is defined as any detonation of a nuclear device intended to test the explosive capabilities of nuclear weaponry. This includes both underground and atmospheric tests. The test must be confirmed by at least two of the following sources: - Official announcement from the North Korean government. - Confirmation by the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organization (CTBTO). - Independent verification by at least two national governments or recognized international organizations. In the absence of direct confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Satellite imagery or other forms of independent verification that conclusively demonstrate a test occurred may also be considered. In the event of ambiguous evidence or claims, the question will resolve as No until conclusive evidence is presented.

title: Will a virology breakthrough lead to a significant reduction in global pandemic threats by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a breakthrough in virology is announced that is widely recognized by the scientific community as having the potential to significantly reduce global pandemic threats. The breakthrough must meet the following criteria:

- It must be a discovery or development in the field of virology that offers a new method or significantly improves existing methods for preventing, detecting, or treating viral infections in a way that could substantially reduce the risk or impact of future pandemics.
- The breakthrough must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference and subsequently reported on by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The breakthrough must be recognized by leading health organizations (e.g., WHO, CDC) as a significant advancement towards reducing global pandemic threats.

In the event that multiple breakthroughs are announced, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria.

title: Will there be a significant legal reform in public health policy due to epidemiological findings by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant legal reform in public health policy is enacted in at least one G7 country (United States, United Kingdom, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan) as a direct result of epidemiological findings. Significant legal reform refers to changes in legislation or policy that substantially alter the public health landscape, such as amendments to public health laws, introduction of new vaccination mandates, or significant changes in funding for public health initiatives. The reform must be attributed to epidemiological findings related to disease prevention, control, or management. Confirmation must come from official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. Temporary measures or emergency declarations that do not result in permanent legal changes do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a major overhaul in drug approval laws influenced by recent pharmacological breakthroughs by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a significant change in drug approval laws in any of the following jurisdictions: the United States, the European Union, or Japan, directly attributed to recent pharmacological breakthroughs. A "major overhaul" is defined as legislative or regulatory changes that substantially alter the process of drug approval, including but not limited to accelerated pathways, changes in clinical trial requirements, or the introduction of new criteria for efficacy or safety assessment. The changes must be officially announced by the respective government or regulatory body. In the absence of an official announcement, confirmation from at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) is required. The overhaul must be aimed at improving the efficiency, safety, or accessibility of drug approval processes. Temporary measures or emergency authorizations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will FIFA implement technology-driven offside calls in all World Cup matches by 2026?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, FIFA has officially implemented technology-driven systems for making offside calls in all World Cup matches. The technology must be capable of automatically detecting offside situations and either making the call or assisting referees in making the call with a high degree of accuracy. Implementation must be confirmed by an official FIFA announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The technology must be used in all matches of the World Cup, not just in select games or as part of a trial. Temporary implementations for specific matches or the use of similar technology in other tournaments do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States see the establishment of a technology-focused committee within the Democratic Party by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Democratic Party in the United States has officially established a committee focused on technology issues. The committee must be recognized by the Democratic National Committee (DNC) and have a clear mandate to address technology-related policies, innovations, and challenges. The establishment of such a committee must be confirmed by an official announcement from the DNC or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). The committee must have held at least one official meeting and have appointed members by the resolution date. In the event of a rebranding or expansion of an existing committee to include a technology focus, this will also resolve as Yes, provided the new mandate is significantly focused on technology.

title: Will Japan launch a government-backed digital currency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Japan has officially launched a government-backed digital currency. The launch must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., NHK, The Japan Times, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Financial Times) are sufficient. The digital currency must be operational and available for use by the general public or specific sectors. Pilot programs, trials, or plans for future deployment do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a partial launch (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes if the currency is intended for nationwide use.

title: Will Brazil introduce significant electoral reform before 2025?
Will a major political figure from a tech company run for public office in the US before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major political figure from a tech company announces their candidacy for any public office in the United States. For the purposes of this question, a "major political figure" is defined as an individual who holds or has held a C-level position (e.g., CEO, CTO, CFO) or is a founder of a technology company that is publicly traded or has a valuation exceeding $1 billion USD. The announcement must be confirmed through official campaign materials or a public declaration by the individual. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The tech company must be primarily involved in the development, production, or sale of technology products or services. This question does not include individuals from companies whose primary business is social media or online retail.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US make a landmark ruling on digital privacy by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling that significantly alters the legal landscape of digital privacy. A "landmark ruling" is defined as a decision that establishes a new legal precedent, significantly changes existing law, or has a broad impact on future cases related to digital privacy. The ruling must directly address issues of digital privacy, including but not limited to data collection, surveillance, data protection, and individual rights in the digital realm. The resolution will be based on official court documents and announcements. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. In the event of multiple relevant rulings, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets the criteria for a "landmark ruling."

title: Will there be a global consensus on ethical guidelines for nuclear technology use by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a global consensus on ethical guidelines for the use of nuclear technology has been established and officially adopted by at least 75% of the member states of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). The consensus must cover at least the following areas: - Civil nuclear power generation. - Nuclear weapons development and disarmament. - Nuclear medicine and research. The guidelines must be documented and publicly available through official IAEA channels or announcements. In the absence of a single comprehensive document, a series of agreements or treaties that collectively meet these criteria will also be considered sufficient. The resolution will rely on official IAEA announcements or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology significantly reduce global energy costs by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology has been officially announced and is widely recognized by the scientific community as having the potential to significantly reduce global energy costs. A "breakthrough" is defined as a development that enables nuclear fusion to be commercially viable and scalable, leading to a reduction in the cost of electricity generation by at least 50% compared to 2023 levels. The breakthrough must be validated by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official announcement from a leading energy research institution. In the absence of such publication or announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The technology must be demonstrated to be scalable and economically feasible for widespread adoption, not merely a theoretical advancement or limited to laboratory conditions.

title: Will advancements in nuclear technology have a significant impact on the value of the US dollar by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, advancements in nuclear technology have been directly linked to a significant impact on the value of the US dollar. A "significant impact" is defined as a change of 5% or more in the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies (e.g., EUR, GBP, JPY, CNY) as reported by the Federal Reserve. The link between nuclear technology advancements and the change in the US dollar's value must be confirmed by economic analyses published in at least three reputable financial or economic journals. In the absence of direct economic analyses, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times, The Wall Street Journal) that attribute the change in value specifically to nuclear technology advancements will suffice. This question does not consider indirect effects, such as general economic growth or geopolitical shifts, unless explicitly linked to nuclear technology advancements.

title: Will DeepMind develop a legal AI that can pass the bar exam in any US state before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, DeepMind develops an artificial intelligence system that successfully passes the bar exam in any US state. The AI must complete the exam under the same conditions as human candidates, without external assistance during the test. The passing of the bar exam must be officially recognized by the relevant state's bar association or legal authority. Confirmation from DeepMind or the bar association, along with coverage by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post), is required for resolution. The AI's success must be attributed to its own capabilities, rather than collaboration with human lawyers or other AI systems.

title: Will the US Supreme Court make a landmark ruling on quantum computing patents by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the US Supreme Court has made a ruling that is widely recognized as a landmark decision regarding the patentability, enforcement, or legal standards of quantum computing technologies. A 'landmark ruling' is defined as a decision that sets a significant new legal precedent, alters the interpretation of existing laws, or significantly influences the development and commercialization of quantum computing technologies. The ruling must be on a case specifically concerning quantum computing patents. Confirmation of such a ruling must come from official court documents or announcements. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. In the event of multiple relevant rulings, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first ruling that meets these criteria.

title: Will a Formula 1 team commit to a major sustainability initiative to reduce its carbon footprint by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any Formula 1 team officially commits to a major sustainability initiative aimed at significantly reducing its carbon footprint. A "major sustainability initiative" is defined as a program or set of actions intended to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by at least 20% from the team's baseline emissions in 2020 or achieve a net-zero carbon footprint by 2030. The commitment must be publicly announced through official team channels or verified by credible news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The initiative can include, but is not limited to, the use of sustainable fuels, energy efficiency improvements, carbon offsetting, and investment in renewable energy. In the event of a dispute over the initiative's significance or the reduction percentage, the resolution will defer to the consensus of three environmental experts in the field of sports sustainability.

title: Will a major aerospace company launch a program to address social inequality in STEM education by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major aerospace company (defined as a company with significant operations in multiple countries and recognized as a leader in aerospace technology) officially launches a program specifically aimed at addressing social inequality in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) education. The program must be designed to significantly increase access to STEM education for underrepresented or disadvantaged groups. The launch of such a program must be confirmed through an official announcement by the company or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The program must be operational and have a clear plan for implementation, including but not limited to scholarships, educational resources, mentorship, and partnerships with educational institutions. Temporary initiatives or one-time events do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the NHL implement a league-wide program to promote mental health awareness among players by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Hockey League (NHL) has officially implemented a league-wide program aimed at promoting mental health awareness among its players. The program must be designed to provide education, resources, and support for mental health issues and must be accessible to all players within the league. The implementation of such a program must be confirmed by an official NHL announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient. The program must be operational, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to certain teams or regions), the question will resolve as Yes if the program is intended for league-wide expansion. Temporary initiatives or programs that are not specifically designed to be accessible to all players do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will DeepMind develop a groundbreaking AI model that surpasses human intelligence in a general domain by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, DeepMind has developed and publicly announced an artificial intelligence model that surpasses human intelligence across a general domain. The model must demonstrate superior performance to human experts in a wide range of cognitive tasks, including but not limited to problem-solving, learning, and understanding complex concepts. The achievement must be verified by an independent panel of experts in artificial intelligence and cognitive science, and reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The model should not be limited to a narrow field of expertise but must exhibit a broad understanding and capability that is recognized as surpassing the general cognitive abilities of humans. In the event of a dispute over the model's capabilities, the resolution will defer to the consensus of the scientific community as reflected in peer-reviewed publications.

title: Will India become a global leader in technology exports by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, India is recognized as a global leader in technology exports. A "global leader" is defined as being ranked in the top three countries worldwide in terms of the total value of technology exports, including but not limited to software, information technology services, and electronics. The ranking must be confirmed by authoritative sources such as the World Trade Organization (WTO), the International Trade Centre (ITC), or other recognized global trade or economic organizations. In the absence of a single authoritative source, a consensus among reputable financial news outlets (e.g., Financial Times, Bloomberg, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. The technology exports considered must be of civilian nature, excluding military technology. In the event of a tie in rankings, the question will resolve as Yes if India is among the tied countries.

title: Will there be a significant technological breakthrough in sports analytics by 2030, specifically impacting the NFL?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant technological breakthrough in sports analytics has been achieved, with a demonstrable impact on the National Football League (NFL). A "significant technological breakthrough" is defined as a development in technology or analytics that leads to a substantial improvement in player performance analysis, injury prediction, game strategy, or fan engagement. The breakthrough must be widely recognized within the sports analytics community and must have been adopted or in the process of being adopted by at least one NFL team. The adoption of the technology must be confirmed by credible sources, including but not limited to official NFL communications, reputable sports news outlets (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic), or peer-reviewed sports science publications. In the event of multiple claims of breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Temporary or experimental uses do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will South Korea launch a lunar exploration mission before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, South Korea officially launches a lunar exploration mission. The mission must be sanctioned by the South Korean government or a recognized South Korean space agency. The launch must be intended for lunar orbit, surface exploration, or both, and must be confirmed by an official announcement or documentation from the responsible agency. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The mission must successfully leave Earth's atmosphere and demonstrate a trajectory towards the Moon. In the event of a launch failure or mission cancellation, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major aerospace company announce a breakthrough in reusable rocket technology before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major aerospace company (defined as a company with a valuation over $1 billion or a significant history of contributions to aerospace technology) announces a breakthrough in reusable rocket technology. A "breakthrough" is defined as a technological development that significantly enhances the efficiency, cost-effectiveness, or safety of reusable rockets, beyond the current state of the art as of 2023. The announcement must be verifiable through an official press release or public statement by the company. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The technology must be demonstrably operational, not merely theoretical or in early development stages. In the event of multiple companies announcing similar breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first verified announcement.

title: Will Tesla announce a new electric vehicle model specifically designed for the European market by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Tesla, Inc. has officially announced a new electric vehicle (EV) model that is specifically designed for and marketed towards the European market. The announcement must clearly state the vehicle's design adaptations or features that cater to European regulations, consumer preferences, or driving conditions distinct from other markets. Confirmation of such an announcement must come directly from Tesla, Inc. through official channels (e.g., press release, official website, Elon Musk's verified social media accounts) or be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). Concept vehicles or prototypes do not count; the model must be intended for commercial production and sale. In the event of ambiguity regarding the vehicle's market specificity, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major technological breakthrough in cybersecurity be developed as a result of the Russo-Ukrainian War by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major technological breakthrough in cybersecurity is developed and publicly acknowledged as a direct result of the Russo-Ukrainian War. A "major technological breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly enhances cybersecurity capabilities, such as a new encryption method, a novel approach to network defense, or a groundbreaking malware detection system. The breakthrough must be recognized by at least one of the following: a leading cybersecurity firm, a major technology company, or a reputable academic journal in the field of cybersecurity. The development must be directly attributed to challenges, experiences, or innovations arising from the Russo-Ukrainian War. In the absence of a direct public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the breakthrough.
