The technology must be beyond the conceptual or trial phase and must have been implemented or adopted in a significant capacity.

title: Will a new form of sustainable energy technology emerge from engineering advancements by 2030?
Will Switzerland introduce electronic voting in national elections by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Switzerland has officially introduced electronic voting in national elections. The introduction of electronic voting must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The electronic voting system must be operational and used in a national election, not merely in a trial phase or proposed for future use. In the event of a partial introduction (e.g., limited to specific cantons or as an option alongside traditional voting methods), the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for nationwide use. Temporary deployments for specific elections or the use of similar technology in non-national elections do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a candidate with a platform focused on advancing robotics technology win a seat in the US Congress by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a candidate whose platform primarily focuses on advancing robotics technology wins a seat in the US Congress. The candidate's platform must explicitly prioritize robotics technology advancement in areas such as legislation, funding, research, and development. The win must be confirmed by an official election result announcement. In the absence of a direct statement regarding the platform's focus on robotics technology, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are required to confirm the platform's focus. The candidate must be elected to either the House of Representatives or the Senate. Interim appointments or special elections are included, provided the candidate's platform meets the specified criteria.

title: Will the NHL implement any major policy changes regarding environmental sustainability by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Hockey League (NHL) has officially implemented one or more major policy changes aimed at improving environmental sustainability. Major policy changes must significantly impact league operations, team practices, or stadium facilities in a manner that reduces environmental impact. Such changes could include, but are not limited to, energy efficiency improvements, waste reduction programs, sustainable transportation initiatives for teams and fans, or the adoption of renewable energy sources. The implementation of these policies must be confirmed through official NHL announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient. Temporary initiatives or minor adjustments to existing policies will not be considered as fulfilling the criteria for this question's resolution.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US make a landmark ruling on environmental protection by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling that is widely recognized as a landmark decision on environmental protection. A "landmark ruling" is defined as a decision that significantly alters, through either expansion or contraction, the scope of environmental protections under U.S. law. This may include, but is not limited to, regulations on pollution, conservation efforts, climate change mitigation, or the legal standing of environmental groups.

The ruling must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Guardian) and must be recognized as a landmark decision by at least two legal experts or scholars in environmental law, as cited in these reports or in subsequent analyses published in reputable legal journals.

In the event that multiple rulings on environmental protection are issued by the Supreme Court by the specified date, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of these rulings meets the criteria outlined above.

title: Will astronomers discover a new Earth-like exoplanet within 50 light-years of Earth by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, astronomers have discovered a new Earth-like exoplanet located within 50 light-years of Earth. An "Earth-like" exoplanet is defined as a terrestrial planet with a mass between 0.5 and 5 Earth masses, orbiting within the habitable zone of its star, where liquid water could exist on the planet's surface. The discovery must be confirmed through peer-reviewed research published in a reputable scientific journal or announced by a major space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA). In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first confirmed discovery. Discoveries announced but not confirmed by the end of 2030 will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Tesla's expansion into new markets significantly influence geopolitical relations by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Tesla's expansion into new markets (countries where Tesla has not previously sold vehicles or established manufacturing facilities as of 2023) has led to significant changes in geopolitical relations. Significant influence on geopolitical relations includes, but is not limited to:
- Formal agreements or partnerships between nations specifically attributed to Tesla's expansion.
- Legislative or policy changes in countries directly related to Tesla's market entry.
- Public acknowledgments by government officials or international bodies of Tesla's role in altering diplomatic or economic ties.

For the purpose of this question, "significant influence" must be confirmed by reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or official government statements from the involved countries. Tesla's expansion is considered in terms of both vehicle sales and the establishment of manufacturing facilities.

In the event of ambiguous situations, a panel of experts in international relations, as cited by major academic or research institutions, will be consulted to determine the significance of Tesla's influence on geopolitical relations.

title: Will the United Nations implement a new global policy that significantly impacts international relations by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Nations has officially implemented a new policy that significantly impacts international relations. The policy must be adopted by a majority vote within the United Nations General Assembly or Security Council and must be aimed at addressing a major global issue such as climate change, international security, human rights, or global health.

Significant impact on international relations is defined as leading to substantial changes in diplomatic relations, international agreements, or global cooperation efforts. The implementation of the policy must be confirmed by an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In the event of a policy aimed at a specific issue, the question will resolve as Yes only if the policy leads to measurable changes in the targeted area within a year of its implementation.

title: Will there be a significant geopolitical event that challenges the current understanding of global power structures by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant geopolitical event occurs that fundamentally challenges or alters the current understanding of global power structures. A "significant geopolitical event" is defined as an event that results in a major shift in international relations, alliances, or power dynamics, such as the emergence of a new superpower, a major conflict involving multiple global powers, or a significant realignment of existing alliances. The event must be recognized as significant by a consensus of experts in international relations and reported as such by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the case of multiple qualifying events, the question will resolve as Yes upon the occurrence of the first event. If no such event is widely recognized and reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant technological breakthrough in tennis equipment manufacturing by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant technological breakthrough in tennis equipment manufacturing is announced. A "significant technological breakthrough" is defined as a development that results in a measurable improvement in performance, durability, or player safety that is recognized by at least one of the following: - A major tennis equipment manufacturer (e.g., Wilson, Babolat, Head). - A governing body of the sport (e.g., International Tennis Federation, ATP, WTA). The breakthrough must be documented in a patent, a peer-reviewed scientific journal, or through an official announcement by the manufacturer or governing body. Improvements must be quantifiable through standardized testing or widely accepted metrics in the sport. Minor improvements, aesthetic changes, or innovations that do not directly impact the performance, durability, or safety of the equipment do not qualify. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, ESPN) are sufficient. The technology must be available to the public and not solely for professional use.

title: Will a major tech company launch a digital platform aimed at enhancing political engagement for the Democratic Party (US) by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major tech company (defined as a company with a market capitalization of over $10 billion USD or a global user base of over 100 million active users) has officially launched a digital platform specifically designed to enhance political engagement for the Democratic Party (US). The platform must be aimed at increasing voter registration, voter turnout, or general political activism among supporters of the Democratic Party. The launch of such a platform must be confirmed by an official announcement from the company or documentation that can be verified. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The platform must be operational and accessible to the public, not in a trial phase. In the event of a collaborative effort involving multiple tech companies, the question will resolve as Yes if the leading company meets the above criteria for a major tech company. Temporary or event-specific platforms do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new international digital ethics agreement be established to regulate AI technologies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new international digital ethics agreement specifically aimed at regulating artificial intelligence technologies is established and officially announced by the United Nations or a similar authoritative international body. The agreement must be adopted by at least 10 member countries and include clear guidelines and standards for the development, deployment, and governance of AI technologies. The establishment of the agreement must be confirmed through official documentation or announcements from the United Nations or the participating countries. In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. The agreement should address at least one of the following areas: data privacy, algorithmic transparency, AI ethics, or the impact of AI on employment. Temporary agreements or frameworks that do not include enforceable standards or are not adopted by member countries do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major cybersecurity incident influence global geopolitical stability before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major cybersecurity incident occurs that is widely recognized to have significantly influenced global geopolitical stability. A "major cybersecurity incident" is defined as a cyber attack or series of attacks that result in: - Significant disruption to the infrastructure or economy of one or more countries; - Escalation of military tensions or conflicts between nations; - Major shifts in international alliances or policies due to the incident. The incident must be confirmed by official government statements from at least two of the involved countries or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the event of conflicting reports about the impact of the incident, the consensus among these sources will be used to determine its significance. Temporary or isolated cyber attacks that do not lead to widespread geopolitical changes do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a significant geopolitical event disrupt the international basketball calendar before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a significant geopolitical event leads to the cancellation, postponement, or significant alteration (e.g., change of venue, exclusion of teams or nations) of any major international basketball event (such as the Olympics, FIBA World Cup, or EuroBasket). A "significant geopolitical event" is defined as an event that involves conflict between nations, significant political decisions or actions (e.g., sanctions, diplomatic expulsions) that directly impact international relations, or widespread civil unrest that affects more than one country's participation in international events. The event must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) and must directly cite the geopolitical event as the reason for the disruption. In the case of multiple disruptions, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first occurrence. In the absence of such an event, the question resolves as No.

title: Will geopolitical tensions lead to the cancellation of an NHL season before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, an entire National Hockey League (NHL) season is officially cancelled due to geopolitical tensions. Geopolitical tensions are defined as conflicts between nations that significantly impact international relations and lead to the decision by the NHL to cancel a season to ensure the safety of players, staff, and fans, or due to government directives. The cancellation must be officially announced by the NHL and reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Partial season delays, shortened seasons, or cancellations for reasons other than geopolitical tensions (e.g., labor disputes, pandemics) will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new machine learning algorithm that significantly outperforms current models in natural language processing be developed by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new machine learning algorithm is developed that significantly outperforms current models in natural language processing (NLP). Significant outperformance is defined as achieving a minimum of 20% improvement in accuracy, efficiency, or another quantifiable metric over the best-performing models as of 2023, in tasks such as language translation, sentiment analysis, or text summarization. The improvement must be verified through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presentation at a major computer science conference. The algorithm must be publicly disclosed and its performance validated by independent researchers or organizations. In the event of multiple algorithms meeting these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first such verification. If no algorithm meets these criteria by the specified date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will China lead the world in quantum computing research by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, China is recognized as the global leader in quantum computing research. Leadership in quantum computing research is defined by the following criteria:
- Publication volume: China must have the highest number of peer-reviewed scientific publications in the field of quantum computing, compared to any other country.
- Citation impact: Chinese publications in quantum computing must have the highest citation impact, indicating significant influence on the field.
- Technological breakthroughs: China must have achieved at least one major technological breakthrough in quantum computing that is recognized by the international scientific community.

Leadership must be confirmed by data from reputable scientific databases (e.g., Web of Science, Scopus) and recognition by international scientific organizations or consensus in the scientific community. In the absence of clear data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In the event of a tie in any of the criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Norway become a leading nation in the development of quantum computing technologies by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Norway is recognized as a leading nation in the development of quantum computing technologies. Recognition can come from:
- Being home to at least one company or research institution that has made a significant breakthrough in quantum computing, as reported by reputable technology or science news outlets (e.g., MIT Technology Review, Nature, Science, IEEE Spectrum).
- Hosting a significant international quantum computing conference.
- Having Norwegian researchers or institutions cited in a significant number of peer-reviewed scientific papers on quantum computing, indicating a leading role in the field.

A "significant breakthrough" in quantum computing includes, but is not limited to, the development of a quantum computer that surpasses existing classical computers in solving specific, practical problems (quantum supremacy), or the invention of scalable quantum computing technologies.

In the event that multiple nations are recognized for their contributions to quantum computing, Norway must be among the top three as reported by a consensus of the aforementioned sources.

title: Will an algorithm capable of solving NP-complete problems in polynomial time be developed by 2035?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, an algorithm is developed that is capable of solving NP-complete problems in polynomial time. The algorithm must be:

- Publicly disclosed in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or at a major computer science conference.
- Independently verified by recognized experts in the field of computational complexity.

The development of such an algorithm must be confirmed by a credible announcement from the institution or individuals responsible for the discovery. In the absence of a direct announcement, confirmation from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, IEEE Spectrum) or a recognized scientific body is required.

In the event that multiple algorithms are developed simultaneously, the resolution will be based on the date of the first public disclosure that meets the above criteria. Algorithms that only claim to solve NP-complete problems without meeting the verification standards will not be considered.

title: Will the United Nations establish a global framework for digital currency regulation by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United Nations (UN) has officially established a global framework for the regulation of digital currencies. The framework must be recognized and adopted by the UN General Assembly or an equivalent body and must provide guidelines or regulations applicable to member states for the governance, use, and oversight of digital currencies. The establishment of such a framework must be confirmed through an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The framework must address at least the following aspects: - Legal status of digital currencies - Anti-money laundering (AML) and counter-terrorism financing (CTF) measures - Consumer protection - Taxation guidelines In the event of a partial or preliminary framework that does not cover all the specified aspects, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the World Health Organization launch a space mission to study the effects of space travel on human health by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the World Health Organization (WHO) has officially launched a space mission aimed at studying the effects of space travel on human health. The mission must be specifically designed to gather data on the physiological, psychological, or biomedical impacts of space travel on humans. The launch of the mission must be confirmed through an official WHO announcement or documentation. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. The mission must have been launched, not merely planned or proposed. Collaborations with space agencies (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA) are acceptable, provided the WHO is a leading or equal partner in the mission's execution.

title: Will a new COVID-19 variant discovered in space lead to global travel restrictions being reimposed before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a new COVID-19 variant originating from space is identified and directly leads to the reimposition of global travel restrictions. The variant must be confirmed through genetic sequencing and recognized by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body in the field of infectious diseases. The reimposition of global travel restrictions must be officially announced by the United Nations or a similar international organization, or by at least five major countries across different continents. The restrictions must be a direct response to the threat posed by the new variant and must apply to international travel, not just specific regions or countries. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient to confirm the reimposition of travel restrictions. The discovery of the variant in space must be verified by an authoritative space exploration agency (e.g., NASA, ESA) or a credible scientific publication.

title: Will SpaceX successfully land humans on Mars before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully lands at least one human on Mars before January 1, 2030. The landing must be confirmed by SpaceX through an official announcement or press release. Additionally, independent verification by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or a recognized space exploration authority (e.g., NASA, ESA) is required. The human(s) must safely land on the Martian surface and perform at least one extravehicular activity (EVA) to be considered successful. In the event of a mission that lands humans on Mars but fails to return them safely to Earth, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the initial landing and EVA criteria are met. Temporary or emergency landings that do not include a planned EVA do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major political party adopt machine learning algorithms to optimize campaign strategies before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major political party in any of the G7 countries (United States, United Kingdom, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan) officially adopts machine learning algorithms to optimize any aspect of its campaign strategies. This includes, but is not limited to, voter targeting, message optimization, fundraising, and resource allocation. The adoption must be confirmed by an official party announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. For the purpose of this question, a 'major political party' is defined as one that has had representation in the national legislature within the last two election cycles.

title: Will China introduce a new policy significantly impacting global trade relations before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the People's Republic of China officially announces or implements a new policy that significantly impacts global trade relations. Significant impact is defined as causing a measurable change in trade volumes, tariffs, or market access for one or more countries, as reported by at least three of the following organizations or publications: World Trade Organization (WTO), International Monetary Fund (IMF), World Bank, Financial Times, Bloomberg, or Reuters. Changes solely affecting bilateral trade agreements without broader implications for global trade do not qualify. In the event of ambiguous impacts, the question will resolve based on the consensus of reports from the aforementioned sources. The policy must be new, not an extension or minor modification of existing policies.

title: Will a current or former NHL player run for a political office in the US before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, any current or former National Hockey League (NHL) player officially announces their candidacy or is officially nominated by a recognized political party to run for any political office within the United States. The political office in question must be at the federal, state, or local level.

For the purposes of this question, a "current or former NHL player" is defined as anyone who has played at least one regular season or playoff game in the NHL. The announcement or nomination must be confirmed by official campaign announcements or by credible news sources such as ESPN, The Athletic, or major national news outlets like The New York Times, The Washington Post, or CNN.

In the event that multiple players announce their candidacy or are nominated, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first official announcement or nomination. Temporary or honorary positions, and roles without election processes (e.g., appointments) do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Brazil introduce regulations specifically targeting cryptocurrency exchanges by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Brazil has officially introduced regulations specifically targeting cryptocurrency exchanges. These regulations must be designed to govern the operation, security, consumer protection, or taxation of cryptocurrency exchanges operating within Brazil. The introduction of such regulations must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Regulations that are part of broader financial or digital asset laws but explicitly mention cryptocurrency exchanges also count towards this question's resolution. Temporary or proposed regulations do not count.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency platform introduce a blockchain solution to verify COVID-19 vaccination records by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major cryptocurrency platform has officially introduced a blockchain solution designed for the verification of COVID-19 vaccination records. A "major cryptocurrency platform" is defined as one that is listed in the top 10 by market capitalization according to CoinMarketCap or a similar authoritative source at the time of the announcement. The solution must be operational and available for use by the public or specific organizations (e.g., healthcare providers, government agencies) and not merely in a proposal or development stage. The introduction of such a solution must be confirmed by an official announcement from the platform or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of multiple platforms introducing similar solutions, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first confirmed announcement.

title: Will the integration of blockchain technology significantly impact the global sports industry, including basketball, by 2025?
Will FIFA significantly increase its financial support for grassroots football programs worldwide by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, FIFA has officially announced an increase in its financial support for grassroots football programs worldwide by at least 50% compared to its 2020 levels. The increase must be sustained over a minimum of two consecutive fiscal years to qualify. Financial support includes, but is not limited to, funding for local clubs, youth development programs, and infrastructure improvements aimed at grassroots levels. The announcement must be confirmed through official FIFA communications or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, BBC Sport, The Athletic, Goal.com) are sufficient. Temporary or one-time grants do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a dispute over the interpretation of 'significant increase,' the question will resolve based on the consensus of financial analysts specializing in sports economics.

title: Will a major breakthrough in genetics lead to a significant increase in global economic productivity by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major breakthrough in genetics is recognized to have led to a significant increase in global economic productivity. A "major breakthrough in genetics" refers to a discovery or technological advancement that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of genetics in a way that has a measurable impact on global economic productivity. This impact must be confirmed by a consensus among economists and reported by at least three reputable economic research institutions or publications (e.g., The Economist, Bloomberg, World Bank reports). The increase in productivity must be significant, defined as a measurable and sustained improvement in global GDP growth rate, labor productivity, or another relevant economic indicator, beyond the trend projections made prior to 2023. In the absence of direct consensus, the resolution will consider the aggregate of economic analyses and reports from the specified sources.

title: Will Mexico's GDP growth rate exceed 3% in the year 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Mexico's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate for the fiscal year 2024 exceeds 3%. The GDP growth rate will be measured based on the percentage change in the real GDP from the previous year, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI) of Mexico. In the event that INEGI does not publish the data by the resolution date or if there is significant controversy over the accuracy of the reported figures, reputable international economic organizations such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank may be used as alternative sources. The resolution will consider the initial figures released by these authorities, not subsequent revisions. In case of discrepancies between sources, the source with the median value will be used to determine the outcome.

title: Will OpenAI develop a model capable of predicting climate change impacts with greater than 90% accuracy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, OpenAI has developed and publicly announced a model that is capable of predicting climate change impacts with greater than 90% accuracy. The model must demonstrate its predictive accuracy through peer-reviewed research or an equivalent validation process recognized by the scientific community. The accuracy must be validated by independent experts or organizations with expertise in climate science. The model should be able to predict specific climate change impacts, such as temperature changes, sea level rise, and extreme weather events, with the stated level of accuracy. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the development of such a model. The resolution criteria do not consider models in a trial phase or unpublished research.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report a significant increase in green jobs in the United States by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports an increase in green jobs of at least 20% from the baseline reported in 2020. For the purposes of this question, "green jobs" are defined as employment positions directly involved in the production of goods or provision of services that benefit the environment or conserve natural resources. These include jobs in renewable energy, energy efficiency, pollution reduction and removal, greenhouse gas reduction, and environmental sustainability. The increase must be reflected in an official BLS report or publication. In the absence of a direct report on green jobs, credible analyses using BLS data by reputable economic research institutions will be considered. The resolution will default to No if the BLS discontinues reporting on green jobs or if there is insufficient data to determine the increase.

title: Will South Korea implement a nationwide carbon neutrality policy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, South Korea has officially implemented a nationwide policy aimed at achieving carbon neutrality. The policy must be comprehensive, covering significant sectors contributing to carbon emissions, including but not limited to energy, transportation, and industry. The implementation of the policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be in effect, not merely proposed or in planning stages. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific sectors or areas), the question will resolve as Yes if the policy is intended for nationwide application and significant steps towards full implementation are evident.

title: Will the global economy enter a recession due to the impact of COVID-19 before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the global economy is officially declared to be in a recession due to the impact of COVID-19. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth on a global scale. The declaration must come from a recognized economic authority, such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the World Bank, or a consensus of national statistics agencies. The impact of COVID-19 must be explicitly cited as a primary cause of the recession. In the absence of a global declaration, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the recession criteria have been met will also be considered sufficient for resolution. This question resolves as YES upon such declaration or reporting.

title: Will a major breakthrough in atmospheric science lead to significant changes in global economic policies before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major breakthrough in atmospheric science leads to significant changes in global economic policies. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that fundamentally alters the understanding or prediction of atmospheric processes, and is recognized as such by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) or a similar authoritative body in the field of atmospheric sciences. Significant changes in global economic policies must be directly attributable to this breakthrough and must be implemented by at least three of the G20 nations. These changes could include, but are not limited to, adjustments in carbon pricing, emissions trading systems, renewable energy subsidies, or other economic mechanisms aimed at mitigating climate change. The implementation of these policies must be confirmed by official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of direct government announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of a partial implementation or if the policies are not maintained through the end of 2029, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will advancements in particle physics result in new industries contributing to global GDP growth before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, advancements in particle physics lead to the establishment of one or more new industries that contribute to global GDP growth. For the purposes of this question, a "new industry" is defined as a sector that did not exist prior to 2023 and is directly based on technologies or discoveries in particle physics. The contribution to global GDP growth must be recognized by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank. The establishment of such industries must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) or by official announcements from relevant industry bodies or governments. In the event of ambiguous cases, the resolution will defer to the consensus of experts in the field of particle physics and economics.

title: Will a major golf tournament be held on the moon before 2050?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2050, a major golf tournament is held on the moon. A "major golf tournament" is defined as an event organized by one of the recognized major golf organizations (e.g., PGA Tour, European Tour, LPGA) or an equivalent organization established for lunar sports, with participation from at least 30 professional golfers. The tournament must consist of at least three rounds of golf, and the course must be located on the lunar surface. The event must be officially sanctioned and recognized by the organizing body, and results must be publicly available. In the event of a virtual or simulated tournament claiming to be held on the moon, this will not count towards the question's resolution. The tournament must be a physical event taking place on the moon, not a virtual simulation.

title: Will the US Congress pass a significant bill funding new space exploration missions before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the US Congress passes a bill that significantly increases funding for new space exploration missions. 

"Significant" is defined as an increase in funding by at least 20% over the previous fiscal year's budget for space exploration, as reported by NASA's official budget documents or a similar authoritative source. 
The bill must be specifically aimed at funding new missions beyond Earth's orbit, including but not limited to lunar exploration, Mars missions, and deep space probes. 

The passage of the bill must be confirmed by an official announcement from the US Congress or NASA. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. 

In the event of a government shutdown or other extraordinary circumstances that delay the budget process, the resolution date will be extended accordingly.

title: Will advancements in string theory lead to a breakthrough in space propulsion technology by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, advancements in string theory have directly led to a breakthrough in space propulsion technology that is:
- Publicly announced by a reputable scientific organization or published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- Recognized as a significant advancement over existing space propulsion technologies by a consensus of experts in the field.
- Demonstrated through either a successful test of the new technology or a detailed theoretical framework that is widely accepted by the scientific community.

For the purposes of this question, a "breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly enhances the efficiency, speed, or capabilities of space propulsion systems beyond the current state of the art. This includes, but is not limited to, new methods of propulsion that could feasibly reduce travel time within our solar system or enable interstellar travel.

In the event that multiple advancements are announced, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria. Developments that are purely theoretical without practical demonstration or widespread acceptance do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in the physics of virus transmission that impacts pandemic management by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant breakthrough in the physics of virus transmission is announced, which has a demonstrable impact on pandemic management. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that leads to a substantial improvement in the prediction, prevention, or control of virus transmission in a way that is widely recognized by the scientific community. The breakthrough must be documented in at least one of the following: a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, an official statement by a leading health organization (e.g., WHO, CDC), or coverage by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, etc.). The impact on pandemic management must be evidenced by implementation in public health policies or practices, as confirmed by a reputable health organization or government body. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Temporary or speculative findings without subsequent validation do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new COVID-19 variant emerge that significantly increases global mortality rates by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new variant of COVID-19 is identified that leads to a significant increase in global mortality rates. A 'significant increase' is defined as a 20% rise in global mortality rates directly attributable to COVID-19, compared to the highest annual global mortality rate recorded between 2020 and 2023. The identification of the variant must be confirmed by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. This question resolves as YES upon official recognition of such a variant by the WHO or CDC, otherwise, it resolves as NO.

title: Will Virginia implement a state-wide health initiative that significantly reduces pandemic-related hospitalizations by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the state of Virginia has officially implemented a health initiative that results in a significant reduction in pandemic-related hospitalizations across the state. A "significant reduction" is defined as a decrease of at least 20% in the annual number of pandemic-related hospitalizations compared to the average annual number recorded in the three years prior to the initiative's implementation. The initiative must be statewide and aimed specifically at reducing the impact of pandemics on hospitalization rates. The reduction must be confirmed by official state health department statistics or credible health research organizations. In the absence of direct state announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Temporary measures or initiatives limited to specific demographics or regions within the state do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Germany launch a manned mission to the Moon by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Germany has successfully launched a manned mission to the Moon. The mission must be officially sanctioned by the German government or a recognized German space agency. The mission is considered successful if it includes a crewed spacecraft that lands on the Moon's surface and returns safely to Earth. Confirmation of the mission's success must come from official government announcements or recognized international space agencies (e.g., ESA, NASA). In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The mission must be primarily funded and operated by Germany, though international collaboration is permitted. In the event of a delay or mission failure, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Taiwan establish its own space agency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Taiwan has officially established its own space agency. The establishment of the agency must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The agency must be recognized as a national entity with a mandate to conduct space exploration, satellite deployment, or other space-related activities. In the event of a declaration of intent without the actual establishment of the agency, or if the agency is only in a planning or preliminary phase by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major breakthrough in aerospace engineering significantly enhance human space travel capabilities by 2030?
Will the value of the US dollar significantly influence voter turnout in the next US presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the day after the next US presidential election, there is significant evidence that fluctuations in the value of the US dollar had a measurable impact on voter turnout. Significant evidence must include statistical analysis from at least three reputable economic research institutions or think tanks, demonstrating a direct correlation between the value of the US dollar and changes in voter turnout rates. The analysis must be specific to the election in question and published in peer-reviewed journals or presented at major economic conferences. Voter turnout is defined as the percentage of eligible voters who cast a ballot in the election. For the purpose of this question, 'significant influence' is defined as a change in voter turnout of at least 2 percentage points directly attributable to the value of the US dollar. In the absence of such evidence, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Mexico hold a referendum on a major electoral reform before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Mexico has officially held a referendum on a major electoral reform. A "major electoral reform" is defined as any change to the electoral system that affects the method of voting, the way votes are counted, or the system for allocating seats in the legislative body. The referendum must be nationwide and the results must be officially announced by the National Electoral Institute (INE) of Mexico or another competent governmental authority. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the referendum has taken place. Temporary measures or reforms applied only to local elections do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major election in the next decade be influenced by genetic data analysis of voters?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2032, there is credible evidence that genetic data analysis has been used to significantly influence voter behavior or election outcomes in any major national election around the world. Significant influence involves the use of genetic information to tailor political messages, advertisements, or strategies specifically to voter's genetic predispositions in a way that demonstrably affects election results. Evidence must come from official election oversight bodies, credible news reports from reputable sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post), or academic studies published in peer-reviewed journals. The election must be national in scope, such as presidential, parliamentary, or general elections. Use of genetic data for voter segmentation or targeting in local elections or primaries does not meet this criterion. In the absence of direct evidence, credible reports from at least three major news organizations are required for resolution. This question does not consider the ethical implications or legality of such practices, focusing solely on the occurrence of the event.

title: Will Elon Musk announce a candidacy for a political office in any country by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Elon Musk has officially announced his candidacy for a political office in any country. The announcement must be made directly by Elon Musk or through an official spokesperson or campaign team. It must be verifiable through Musk's official social media accounts, official press releases, or coverage by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). Announcements made in jest, hypothetical discussions, or comments made in interviews without an official campaign launch do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a dispute over the seriousness of the announcement, the consensus of coverage by the aforementioned news organizations will be used to determine the outcome.

title: Will a major political party in a G7 country adopt a platform including significant microbiology research funding by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any major political party in a G7 country (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States) officially adopts a platform or policy proposal that includes a significant increase in funding for microbiology research. 

For the purposes of this question, a "significant increase" is defined as an increase of at least 20% from the current levels of funding as of 2023, adjusted for inflation. The platform or policy must be publicly announced and documented. 

In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the adoption of such a platform. 

In the event of ambiguity regarding what constitutes a "major political party," the party must have had representation in the national legislature or have received at least 15% of the vote in the most recent national election.

title: Will a new form of life be discovered in space by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new form of life is discovered in space, which must meet the following criteria for consideration as a new form of life:

- The life form must not be of Earth-origin, as confirmed through genetic, biochemical, or morphological analysis.
- The discovery must be made through direct observation or analysis of specimens retrieved from space environments (e.g., other planets, moons, asteroids, or interstellar space).
- The discovery must be recognized and confirmed by the scientific community, with findings published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.

In the event of a discovery by a private entity, confirmation by an independent scientific organization or a collaboration of space agencies (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA) is required for resolution. Discoveries that are contested or lack consensus within the scientific community do not meet the resolution criteria.

This question resolves as YES upon official recognition of the discovery by at least two of the aforementioned space agencies or by one of these agencies together with a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

title: Will dark matter be directly detected by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a direct detection of dark matter that is widely recognized and confirmed by the scientific community. Direct detection must involve the observation of dark matter particles through their interactions with ordinary matter or radiation in a manner that is unambiguous and reproducible. The detection must be confirmed by at least two independent experiments and recognized by leading scientific organizations or published in at least two peer-reviewed scientific journals. The resolution will rely on reports from reputable scientific sources such as Nature, Science, or Physical Review Letters. In the event of conflicting reports or inconclusive evidence, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report an increase in employment within the space sector by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports an increase in employment within the space sector compared to its last report prior to 2023. The space sector includes but is not limited to companies and organizations involved in space exploration, satellite manufacturing, space tourism, and related research and development activities. An increase in employment must be explicitly mentioned in the BLS's official reports or press releases. In the absence of a specific report on the space sector by the BLS, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) confirming the increase will be considered sufficient for resolution. The question will resolve as No if there is no reported increase or if the BLS discontinues its reporting on this sector.

title: Will the United States lead a major breakthrough in quantum computing before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the United States is officially recognized as leading a major breakthrough in quantum computing. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly advances the field of quantum computing, such as achieving quantum supremacy for a new class of problems, creating a quantum computer with a significant increase in qubits that are stable and error-corrected, or developing a new algorithm that substantially enhances quantum computing capabilities.

The breakthrough must be recognized by a leading scientific organization or journal in the field of quantum computing, such as the Quantum Computing Institute, Nature, or Science. Additionally, the breakthrough must be widely reported by at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

In the event of multiple countries contributing to a breakthrough, the question will resolve as Yes only if the United States is credited as the primary contributor or leader in the effort.

title: Will Japan develop a supercomputer that tops the global computing power rankings before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Japan develops a supercomputer that is ranked number one in the global computing power rankings as published by the TOP500 list.

The supercomputer must be fully operational and its performance verified by the TOP500 organization. The rankings are updated twice a year, and the supercomputer must hold the number one spot in at least one of these updates to meet the resolution criteria.

In the event that the TOP500 list is discontinued or replaced, an equivalent authoritative source recognized by the international computing community will be used to determine the resolution.

Temporary rankings due to testing or incomplete construction do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a significant advancement in computational models for aerospace engineering be made by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant advancement in computational models for aerospace engineering is announced. A "significant advancement" is defined as a development that results in at least a 20% improvement in efficiency, accuracy, or computational speed in aerospace engineering simulations or designs, as compared to the state-of-the-art models as of 2023. The advancement must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major aerospace engineering conference. The announcement must be recognized and validated by a reputable aerospace engineering institution or organization. In the absence of a single advancement meeting these criteria, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, "computational models" include software or algorithms used for the simulation, design, or analysis of aerospace vehicles and components.

title: Will Taiwan declare formal independence from China before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Taiwan officially declares its formal independence from China. The declaration must be made by the President of Taiwan or an equivalent governmental authority and must be intended to establish Taiwan as a sovereign state separate from the People's Republic of China. The declaration must be recognized by at least one of the following: the United Nations, the United States, the European Union, or any three members of the G7. In the absence of such recognition, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the declaration will suffice for resolution. Temporary or symbolic declarations, or statements of intent without formal governmental action, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will China experience a significant shift in its territorial claims in the South China Sea before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the People's Republic of China officially announces a significant shift in its territorial claims in the South China Sea. A "significant shift" is defined as any of the following:
- Official renunciation of claims over specific territories currently claimed by China.
- Formal agreement with one or more Southeast Asian nations on the demarcation of maritime boundaries that results in a reduction of the areas claimed by China.
- An international court decision that results in China officially relinquishing claims, and China publicly acknowledges and agrees to comply with the decision.

The announcement must come from an official government source. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the shift. Temporary adjustments or negotiations without formal agreement do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major geopolitical event be influenced by AI technology developed by DeepMind before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major geopolitical event is significantly influenced by artificial intelligence technology developed by DeepMind. A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that has a substantial impact on international relations, such as a change in leadership of a country, the initiation or resolution of a conflict, significant shifts in alliances, or impactful changes in international policies or treaties. The influence of AI technology must be acknowledged by at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or an official statement from a government or international organization. The AI's role must be substantial in decision-making, strategy formulation, or in the execution of actions leading to the event. Temporary or minor influences, such as the use of AI for data analysis without significant impact on the outcome, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Elon Musk initiate a large-scale social science research project by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Elon Musk has initiated a large-scale social science research project. A "large-scale" project is defined as one involving at least 100 participants or receiving at least $1 million in funding. The project must be focused on social science research, including but not limited to sociology, psychology, economics, political science, or anthropology. The initiation of the project must be confirmed through official announcements from Elon Musk or his affiliated companies or organizations. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. The project must be new, starting on or after the date of this question's posting, and not an extension of existing projects.

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI model focused on solving major social science questions by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, DeepMind has officially announced the development of an artificial intelligence model that is specifically designed to address major social science questions, including but not limited to economics, sociology, political science, and anthropology. The model must aim to provide insights, predictions, or solutions to fundamental or applied problems within these fields. The announcement must be verifiable through official DeepMind communications or credible media reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The AI model must be described as having the capability to analyze complex social systems, predict social outcomes, or propose solutions to social issues. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from major news organizations or publications in peer-reviewed journals that detail the model's capabilities and objectives will suffice. This question resolves as NO if no such model has been announced or reported by the specified date.

title: Will South Korea become the leading country in social science research by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, South Korea is recognized as the leading country in social science research based on the following criteria:

- Publication Volume: South Korea must have the highest number of peer-reviewed social science research publications compared to any other country, as reported by a recognized global database such as Scopus or Web of Science.
- Citation Impact: South Korean social science research publications must have the highest citation impact, measured by the average number of citations per publication, compared to any other country.
- International Awards: South Korea must have received the most prestigious international awards in social science research, such as the Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences, the Holberg Prize, or similar, compared to any other country.

The assessment of South Korea's leadership in social science research will be based on data and reports from authoritative sources, including academic databases, international award committees, and recognized global rankings in research and innovation. In the event of a tie in any of the criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Mexico implement a major legal reform in its criminal justice system by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Mexico has officially implemented a major legal reform in its criminal justice system. A "major legal reform" is defined as a comprehensive overhaul or significant amendment to the existing criminal laws, procedures, or judicial structures that is recognized as such by the Mexican government or its legal institutions. The reform must aim to address systemic issues within the criminal justice system, such as reducing corruption, improving efficiency, enhancing fairness, or increasing access to justice. The implementation of the reform must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific states or judicial districts), the question will resolve as Yes if the reform is intended for nationwide application.

title: Will there be a significant legal development in biotechnology patent law in the US by 2025?
Will FIFA introduce a new law significantly impacting player transfers by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, FIFA has officially introduced a new law that significantly impacts player transfers in international football. A law is considered "significant" if it alters the existing framework for player transfers in a way that affects the majority of transfers, introduces new requirements for player eligibility, changes financial regulations (e.g., transfer fees, salary caps), or modifies the transfer window period. The introduction of such a law must be confirmed by an official FIFA announcement. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, BBC Sport, The Guardian Sports, or similar) are sufficient. Temporary measures or adjustments that do not lead to permanent changes in the transfer system do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Italy introduce a significant tax reform on cryptocurrencies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Italy has officially introduced a significant tax reform specifically targeting cryptocurrencies. A "significant tax reform" is defined as any legal or regulatory change that alters the taxation rate, reporting requirements, or classification of cryptocurrencies in a manner that substantially impacts individuals or entities holding, trading, or using cryptocurrencies within Italy. The introduction of such a reform must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Minor adjustments to existing tax policies or clarifications of current regulations do not qualify as significant reform for the purpose of this question.

title: Will the United Nations establish a global framework for cryptocurrency regulation by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Nations has officially established a global framework for the regulation of cryptocurrencies. The framework must be recognized and adopted by at least 50% of UN member states to qualify. The establishment of such a framework must be confirmed through an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The framework must include guidelines on the legal status of cryptocurrencies, anti-money laundering (AML) standards, and consumer protection measures. In the event of a partial adoption (e.g., less than 50% of UN member states adopting the framework), the question will resolve as No. Temporary measures or recommendations without formal adoption do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the US Congress pass a comprehensive cryptocurrency regulation bill by 2025?
Will DeepMind develop a machine learning model that significantly improves the safety of nuclear reactors by 2030?
Will a breakthrough in string theory lead to a new method of nuclear waste disposal by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, a breakthrough in string theory has led to the development and official announcement of a new method for nuclear waste disposal. The method must be scientifically validated and recognized as a direct result of string theory research. Validation includes peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific journal, endorsement by a recognized scientific institution, or implementation by a national or international nuclear energy authority. The new method must demonstrate a significant improvement over existing nuclear waste disposal techniques in terms of efficiency, safety, or environmental impact. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The question will resolve as No if such a breakthrough has not been publicly announced or recognized by the scientific community by the specified date.

title: Will DeepMind's research lead to a significant reduction in nuclear accident risks by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, DeepMind's research has led to a significant reduction in nuclear accident risks. A "significant reduction" is defined as a decrease in the global annual probability of nuclear accidents by at least 20%, compared to the probability as of 2023. The reduction must be attributable to technologies or methodologies developed directly by DeepMind and implemented in operational nuclear facilities. The assessment of the reduction must be confirmed by an official report from the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) or a similar authoritative body. In the absence of such a report, credible evidence from at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or peer-reviewed scientific publications is required. Technologies in trial phases or not yet implemented in operational facilities do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will China launch a state-backed cryptocurrency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the People's Republic of China has officially launched a state-backed cryptocurrency. The cryptocurrency must be recognized and endorsed by the People's Bank of China or another relevant governmental authority as an official currency for transactions within or outside of China. The launch must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be operational and available for use by the general public or specific sectors. Pilot programs, trials, or digital currency initiatives not officially recognized as a state-backed cryptocurrency do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Virginia implement a blockchain-based voting system by 2026?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, the state of Virginia has officially implemented a blockchain-based voting system for state or federal elections. The system must be fully operational and used in at least one official election. Implementation is defined as the system being used by voters to cast ballots in a way that is recognized and counted towards an official election result. The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must not be in a trial phase and should be intended for continued use in future elections. Temporary or pilot programs that are not intended for permanent or ongoing use do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Tesla accept Bitcoin as payment for its vehicles worldwide by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Tesla, Inc. has officially announced and implemented the acceptance of Bitcoin as a form of payment for its vehicles in all countries where Tesla operates. The acceptance must be continuous and not limited to promotional periods. Confirmation must come from an official Tesla announcement or press release. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Reuters, Bloomberg) will be considered sufficient evidence. The service must be available directly through Tesla's official sales channels, including its website and physical stores. Transactions must be completed using Bitcoin without the need for intermediary currency conversions. In the event of a temporary suspension followed by a reinstatement of Bitcoin acceptance, the question will resolve as Yes only if the reinstatement occurs before the resolution date and is intended to be permanent.

title: Will the COVID-19 pandemic lead to significant long-term environmental policy changes worldwide by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there are significant long-term environmental policy changes implemented worldwide as a direct response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Significant changes are defined as:
- The adoption of new, global or multi-national environmental agreements or treaties that address issues highlighted by the pandemic, such as wildlife conservation, reduction of air pollution, or promotion of sustainable energy sources.
- The implementation of national policies in at least 10 countries that significantly reduce carbon emissions, promote renewable energy, increase funding for environmental conservation, or enhance regulations on wildlife trade and habitat protection, directly citing the COVID-19 pandemic as a catalyst.

The policies must be officially announced by the respective governments or international bodies. Verification will be based on reports from reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or official publications from the United Nations or similar international organizations.

In the absence of such policies, the question resolves as No.

title: Will China implement a new national policy to significantly reduce carbon emissions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the People's Republic of China has officially implemented a new national policy aimed at significantly reducing carbon emissions. The policy must aim for a reduction target that is at least 20% lower than the country's total carbon emissions reported for the year 2020. The implementation of such a policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be in active enforcement, not merely proposed or in planning stages. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific sectors or regions), the question will resolve as Yes if the policy is intended for nationwide application and meets the reduction target.

title: Will the US Senate pass a major climate change legislation by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the US Senate has passed legislation that is significantly focused on addressing climate change. The legislation must include at least one of the following measures: - A carbon pricing mechanism (e.g., carbon tax, cap and trade). - Substantial funding (exceeding $10 billion) for renewable energy projects or climate change mitigation efforts. - Significant regulatory changes aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The passage of the legislation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. The legislation must be signed into law by the President of the United States to count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a veto or failure to sign into law, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new antibiotic-resistant superbug emerge by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new antibiotic-resistant superbug is identified. A "superbug" is defined as a strain of bacteria that has become resistant to antibiotic drugs previously effective for treating its kind.
