The emergence of the superbug must be confirmed by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). In the absence of confirmation from these organizations, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The superbug must exhibit resistance to at least three classes of antibiotics and be identified as a significant threat to public health.

title: Will Iran experience a major pandemic outbreak before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Iran experiences a major pandemic outbreak. A "major pandemic outbreak" is defined as an event where:
- The outbreak is declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO).
- The outbreak results in at least 10,000 confirmed cases within Iran, as reported by the Iranian Ministry of Health and Medical Education or the WHO.

In the absence of official announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the outbreak.

This question resolves as YES upon official recognition of the outbreak by the WHO or the Iranian Ministry of Health and Medical Education. Otherwise, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will a significant breakthrough in pandemic prevention be attributed to environmental science discoveries by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant breakthrough in pandemic prevention is officially attributed to discoveries in the field of environmental science. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or series of discoveries that lead to a substantial reduction in pandemic risk or the development of a novel, effective pandemic prevention strategy. The attribution must come from a recognized health or scientific organization (e.g., WHO, CDC, a national health ministry, or a leading scientific journal) and be supported by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. Discoveries may include, but are not limited to, new insights into zoonotic disease transmission, environmental monitoring and prediction technologies, or sustainable practices that reduce pandemic risk. In the absence of a single, definitive breakthrough, this question will resolve as Yes if a consensus among experts in the field, as reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post), indicates that environmental science discoveries have played a crucial role in pandemic prevention strategies developed by 2025.

title: Will Mexico introduce a national cryptocurrency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Mexico has officially introduced a national cryptocurrency. The introduction of such a cryptocurrency must be confirmed by an official government announcement or legislation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be recognized as legal tender within Mexico and intended for general public use, not limited to specific sectors or pilot programs. In the event of a pilot program announcement without full implementation, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency platform introduce a feature to support biodiversity conservation by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major cryptocurrency platform has officially introduced a feature specifically designed to support biodiversity conservation. A "major cryptocurrency platform" is defined as one that is among the top 10 by trading volume according to CoinMarketCap or a similar authoritative cryptocurrency market analysis site at the time of the feature's introduction. The feature must directly contribute to biodiversity conservation efforts, such as through funding conservation projects, enabling carbon offset purchases, or facilitating the trading of biodiversity credits. The introduction of the feature must be confirmed by an official announcement from the platform or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Norway ban the mining of cryptocurrencies due to environmental concerns by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Norway has officially enacted legislation or regulations that result in a nationwide ban on the mining of cryptocurrencies, specifically citing environmental concerns as the primary reason for the ban. The ban must apply to all forms of cryptocurrency mining within Norway's jurisdiction and must be enforceable by law. Confirmation of such a ban must come from official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. Temporary measures or partial bans targeting specific cryptocurrencies do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in the use of nuclear technology for medical purposes by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant breakthrough in the use of nuclear technology for medical purposes is announced. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a development that leads to a new nuclear medicine treatment or diagnostic technique that is approved by a major health regulatory authority (e.g., FDA in the United States, EMA in Europe) or a consensus in the scientific community as represented by publication in a peer-reviewed medical journal or endorsement by a leading medical organization. The breakthrough must represent a substantial improvement in treatment efficacy, diagnostic accuracy, or patient safety compared to existing nuclear medicine technologies. Developments that are only incremental improvements or that do not receive regulatory approval or scientific consensus by the specified date do not meet the criteria for resolution. In the event of multiple claims of breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes only if at least one meets the above criteria.

title: Will a new method of genetic mutation correction using nuclear technology be developed by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, a new method of genetic mutation correction using nuclear technology has been developed and verified. The method must demonstrate practical application in either human or animal models, with results published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. The development must be recognized and validated by a leading scientific or medical authority, such as the World Health Organization, the National Institutes of Health, or a similar organization. The technology should specifically involve the use of nuclear processes or radiation for direct correction of genetic mutations. In the event that multiple methods are reported, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first method's verification. Developments that only indirectly affect genetic mutations through nuclear technology (e.g., cancer treatment improvements) do not meet the criteria for resolution. In the absence of peer-reviewed publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient for resolution.

title: Will Google invest in nuclear fusion technology research by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Google (or its parent company, Alphabet Inc.) has officially announced an investment in nuclear fusion technology research. The investment can be in the form of financial backing, partnership, or the establishment of a dedicated research division within the company. The announcement must be confirmed through official Google or Alphabet Inc. press releases, SEC filings, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). Investments in companies or projects that are primarily focused on other forms of energy, but include nuclear fusion as a secondary objective, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major computing company sponsor a professional basketball analytics tool by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major computing company (defined as a company with a market capitalization of over $10 billion USD as of 2023) has officially sponsored a professional basketball analytics tool. The tool must be designed for use by professional basketball teams or leagues and must offer advanced analytics capabilities beyond traditional statistical analysis. The sponsorship must be confirmed through an official announcement by the company or the recipient organization (e.g., a professional basketball team, league, or a sports analytics company). In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The analytics tool must be operational and available for use, not merely in development or proposed.

title: Will California lead the US in quantum computing startups by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, California is the state with the highest number of active quantum computing startups in the United States. A "quantum computing startup" is defined as a company founded after January 1, 2010, that is primarily focused on the development or application of quantum computing technology and is headquartered in the United States. The count of startups will be based on data from reputable business databases such as Crunchbase, PitchBook, or similar. In the event of a tie between California and another state, the question will resolve as Yes if California has been leading for the majority of the year 2025. The resolution will rely on publicly available data or reports from credible sources in the technology industry.

title: Will the first robot capable of performing complex mathematical proofs autonomously be developed by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a robot has been developed that is capable of autonomously performing complex mathematical proofs without human intervention. A "complex mathematical proof" is defined as a proof that requires advanced understanding and application of mathematical theories and concepts, typically beyond undergraduate level mathematics. The robot must be able to generate proofs in a manner that is recognized and validated by the mathematical community. Validation can come from the robot's proofs being published in peer-reviewed mathematical journals, or by being accepted and presented at major mathematical conferences. The development of such a robot must be confirmed by credible sources, including but not limited to, official announcements from research institutions, universities, or recognized leaders in the field of robotics or mathematics. In the event of multiple claims of development, the resolution will be based on the first documented and verified instance of a robot meeting these criteria.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be developed to fund immunology research by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a cryptocurrency specifically designed to fund immunology research has been developed and officially launched. The cryptocurrency must have a clear mechanism for funding research in the field of immunology, such as direct funding, grants, or donations to recognized research institutions or projects. The development and launch of the cryptocurrency must be verified through official announcements from the development team or supporting organization. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least two major financial or technology news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times, TechCrunch) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be operational and available for public trading or donation purposes. Cryptocurrencies with a broader scope that include immunology research among other goals do not meet this criterion unless the primary focus is immunology research.

title: Will a cricket-themed cryptocurrency become popular among sports fans by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a cryptocurrency with a theme centered around the sport of cricket has achieved widespread popularity among sports fans. Popularity is defined as having at least 500,000 active users or holders, and being regularly featured in discussions on major sports news platforms (ESPN, Sky Sports, Cricbuzz) or social media. The cryptocurrency must be specifically designed with cricket themes, such as using cricket terminology for transactions, rewards based on cricket match outcomes, or partnerships with cricket leagues or teams. Verification of popularity will be based on user data reports from the cryptocurrency's managing entity, coverage in at least three reputable sports news outlets, and social media analysis confirming active engagement from the sports community. In the absence of clear data, a consensus of expert opinion from the cryptocurrency and sports industry may be considered. This question will resolve as No if these criteria are not met by the specified date.

title: Will France regulate the use of cryptocurrencies more strictly by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, France has enacted new legislation or regulations that impose stricter controls on the use, trading, or mining of cryptocurrencies compared to the regulatory framework in place as of December 31, 2023.

Stricter controls may include, but are not limited to, enhanced verification processes for cryptocurrency transactions, increased taxation, stricter requirements for cryptocurrency exchanges and wallets, and the introduction of new reporting requirements for cryptocurrency holdings.

The enactment of such regulations must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary measures or proposals that have not been officially enacted do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major pharmaceutical company announce a breakthrough in medication that significantly impacts the global economy before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major pharmaceutical company announces a breakthrough in medication that has a significant impact on the global economy. A "significant impact" is defined as causing a measurable change in global economic indicators such as GDP growth rates, healthcare spending, or pharmaceutical market dynamics. The announcement must be confirmed by the company through an official press release or public statement. In addition, the impact of the medication must be corroborated by analysis from at least three reputable financial or economic institutions (e.g., IMF, World Bank, Bloomberg). The medication must be a new development, not a modification of existing treatments, and must be approved for use by a major health authority such as the FDA, EMA, or WHO. In the absence of direct economic data, consensus among economic experts reported in major news outlets (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Reuters) will be sufficient for resolution. This question will resolve as No if these conditions are not met by the specified date.

title: Will Brazil become one of the top 5 economies in the world by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, Brazil is officially ranked among the top 5 economies in the world based on nominal GDP. The ranking must be confirmed by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) World Economic Outlook database or a similar authoritative source. In the event that the IMF does not provide a clear ranking, the World Bank's data will be used as a secondary source. The measurement will be based on the latest available data for the year 2035. If Brazil enters the top 5 at any point during the year but falls out before the end of the year, the question will resolve as No. In case of a tie for the fifth position, the question will resolve as Yes.

title: Will a major golf equipment manufacturer announce a technological breakthrough that significantly impacts the sport's market value before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major golf equipment manufacturer (defined as a company with at least 5% global market share in golf equipment sales as of 2023) announces a technological breakthrough in golf equipment that is widely recognized to have a significant impact on the sport's market value. The announcement must be verifiable through an official press release or public statement by the company. The technological breakthrough must be related to the performance, sustainability, or accessibility of golf equipment, and its impact on the sport's market value must be reported on by at least three reputable financial or sports news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, ESPN, Financial Times, The Wall Street Journal). In the event of multiple announcements, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets these criteria. Temporary or experimental technologies that are not made available to the public do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Amazon rainforest's deforestation rate decrease by 50% before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, the annual deforestation rate of the Amazon rainforest has decreased by 50% or more compared to the baseline year of 2020. The deforestation rate is defined as the total area of forest cleared, measured in square kilometers. The resolution will be based on data reported by the National Institute for Space Research (INPE) of Brazil or any other authoritative environmental research organization recognized globally. In the event that INPE or equivalent organizations cease to exist or do not provide updated data, reputable international environmental organizations (e.g., World Wildlife Fund, Greenpeace) or a consensus of reports from major news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian) will be used to determine the outcome. The resolution will consider the most recent and comprehensive data available up to the resolution date. Temporary fluctuations in deforestation rates due to natural events (e.g., wildfires) that are not indicative of a sustained decrease in deforestation efforts will not affect the resolution of this question.

title: Will a major environmental scandal related to unethical corporate practices be uncovered before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major environmental scandal involving unethical corporate practices is uncovered. A "major environmental scandal" is defined as an incident that causes significant harm to the environment, involves illegal or highly unethical behavior by a corporation, and receives widespread media coverage. The scandal must be confirmed by credible evidence and reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The incident must involve practices such as illegal dumping of hazardous waste, significant pollution exceeding legal limits, or other actions causing substantial environmental damage. In the event of multiple incidents, the question will resolve as Yes upon the uncovering of the first incident meeting these criteria.

title: Will Iran's oil export revenues exceed $100 billion before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, Iran's annual oil export revenues exceed $100 billion in any fiscal year. The revenues will be measured in US dollars for consistency. This determination will be based on official data released by the Iranian government or credible international financial institutions such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank. In the absence of official data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Exchange rate fluctuations will be taken into account, using the average exchange rate of the fiscal year in question. Sanctions, oil price volatility, and other external factors affecting Iran's ability to export oil will not affect the resolution of this question.

title: Will Taiwan's semiconductor industry's global market share increase to over 60% by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Taiwan's semiconductor industry's global market share has increased to over 60%. The market share will be determined based on the annual revenue reported by the Semiconductor Industry Association (SIA) or an equivalent authoritative industry body. The calculation of market share will include all segments of the semiconductor industry, including but not limited to manufacturing, design, and sales of semiconductors. In the event that the SIA or equivalent body does not provide a clear figure for Taiwan's market share, the resolution will be based on the consensus of reports from at least three reputable financial or industry news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times, Reuters). In case of discrepancies between sources, the average of the reported figures will be used. Temporary fluctuations within the year 2025 are not considered; the market share must be sustained at or above 60% as of the end of the fiscal year 2025.

title: Will the value of the US dollar influence the salary caps of major sports leagues by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is an official announcement or documented evidence that the value of the US dollar has directly influenced the setting or adjustment of salary caps in any of the major sports leagues (NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL). The influence of the US dollar must be explicitly mentioned in the context of salary cap adjustments. Verification can come from official league announcements, credible financial reports, or statements from league officials. In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient. This question does not consider indirect influences such as general economic conditions or inflation rates unless explicitly linked to the salary cap adjustments by the sources mentioned.

title: Will a major sports event be named after a discovery related to black holes by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major sports event (e.g., the Olympics, FIFA World Cup, Super Bowl, Wimbledon, or similar) is officially named after a discovery related to black holes. The event must be recognized internationally and attract significant global viewership. The naming must be directly related to a black hole discovery, such as naming the event after a black hole, a scientist known for black hole research, or a concept in black hole physics. Confirmation must come from the official organizing body of the event or be widely reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, ESPN). In the case of multiple events meeting these criteria, the first to be officially announced will be considered for resolution. Temporary or promotional names not used during the actual event do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will DeepMind develop a system that revolutionizes sports analytics by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, DeepMind has developed and publicly announced a system that significantly advances the field of sports analytics. The system must demonstrate a novel approach or significant improvement in at least one of the following areas: player performance prediction, injury risk assessment, game strategy optimization, or fan engagement analytics. The announcement must be confirmed through official DeepMind channels or credible media reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The system must be in use or scheduled for implementation by professional sports teams or leagues. In the event of a dispute over the system's impact, the consensus of at least three experts in sports analytics, interviewed by reputable media, will be considered definitive. The system must not be a minor update to existing technologies but represent a clear breakthrough in the application of AI to sports analytics.

title: Will California lead the US in nuclear energy production by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, California is the leading state in the United States in terms of nuclear energy production. Nuclear energy production is measured in megawatt-hours (MWh) generated from nuclear power plants within the state. The comparison will be based on the official energy production data published by the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) or any successor organization responsible for energy statistics in the United States. In the event that the EIA does not publish data for 2030 by the resolution date, the question will resolve using the most recent full year of data available. If California temporarily leads in nuclear energy production at any point in 2030 due to temporary shutdowns or reductions in production in other states, but does not end the year as the leader, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Iran announce the development of a new nuclear reactor by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Islamic Republic of Iran officially announces the development of a new nuclear reactor. The announcement must be made through official government channels, including but not limited to press releases, government websites, or statements by high-ranking officials. The reactor must be intended for energy production, research, or any other peaceful or military use. Verification of the announcement will rely on reports from at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of direct government announcement, credible evidence provided by international nuclear agencies (e.g., International Atomic Energy Agency) or intelligence reports made public by other sovereign states will also be considered sufficient for resolution. The development refers to the initiation of construction or significant advancement in planning or design that is publicly acknowledged by the Iranian government or verified through credible sources. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the question will resolve as Yes only if the consensus among the cited sources supports the development of a new reactor.

title: Will Virginia decommission any of its nuclear power plants by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the state of Virginia has officially decommissioned at least one of its nuclear power plants. Decommissioning is defined as the process of retiring a nuclear power plant from service, which may include the cessation of power generation and the initiation of the decommissioning process as recognized by the United States Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC). Official confirmation must come from the NRC or an official state announcement. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. This question resolves as NO if no nuclear power plant in Virginia has begun the decommissioning process by the specified date.

title: Will Mexico's recent social policies significantly impact its poverty rate by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Mexico's national poverty rate has decreased by at least 5 percentage points from its reported level in 2020, as measured by the National Council for the Evaluation of Social Development Policy (CONEVAL) or its successor organization. The poverty rate is defined as the percentage of the population living below the national poverty line, which includes considerations of income and access to essential services. In the absence of data from CONEVAL, reputable international organizations such as the World Bank or the United Nations may be used as alternative sources. Significant impact is defined as a clear and measurable reduction in the poverty rate attributable to the social policies implemented from 2020 onwards. In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus among these sources will be used to determine the outcome. Temporary or emergency measures not intended as long-term policy changes do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a Supreme Court of the US decision before 2025 significantly alter the landscape of civil rights?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a decision that significantly alters the landscape of civil rights in the United States. A decision is considered "significant" if it results in a major change in the legal interpretation, enforcement, or recognition of civil rights, including but not limited to issues of equality, freedom of speech, privacy, and the right to a fair trial. The decision must be recognized as having a broad impact on civil rights by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Guardian) or by a consensus of legal experts in peer-reviewed publications. Changes that are purely procedural or that do not have a wide-reaching impact on civil rights as defined above will not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of ambiguity, the consensus among major legal scholars and publications will be considered.

title: Will the NFL's efforts to address social justice issues lead to a measurable change in public opinion by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a measurable change in public opinion regarding the NFL's efforts to address social justice issues. A "measurable change" is defined as a statistically significant shift in public opinion as reported by at least three reputable polling organizations (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research Center, YouGov). The change must be directly attributed to the NFL's initiatives and efforts in social justice, as evidenced by the polling organizations' analysis. The question will resolve as No if such a change is not documented. In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the majority of the cited polls. For clarity, "social justice issues" include, but are not limited to, racial equality, police brutality, and gender equality.

title: Will Russia introduce new legislation that significantly impacts international law by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Russia has introduced new legislation that significantly impacts international law. Significant impact on international law includes, but is not limited to, changes in international treaties, substantial alterations in diplomatic relations, or major shifts in international trade policies. The legislation must be officially passed and recognized by the Russian government. Confirmation of such legislation and its international impact must be reported by at least two of the following reputable news organizations: BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post. In the event of ambiguous situations or disputes over the significance of the legislation's impact, the consensus among these news sources will be considered authoritative. If no such legislation is passed, or if its impact is deemed insignificant by these standards, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Joe Biden appoint a Supreme Court Justice who significantly influences a landmark ruling on digital privacy by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a Supreme Court Justice appointed by Joe Biden has played a significant role in a landmark ruling on digital privacy. A "landmark ruling" is defined as a Supreme Court decision that establishes, overturns, significantly alters, or clarifies a major aspect of digital privacy law in the United States.

The influence of the appointed Justice must be evident either through the authorship of the majority opinion, a concurring opinion that provides a distinct rationale, or a dissenting opinion that is widely cited for its insights on digital privacy. The ruling must be recognized as "landmark" by at least two major legal analysis platforms or scholarly journals.

In the event of multiple rulings on digital privacy, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets the above criteria. If no such ruling occurs, or if the appointed Justice does not significantly influence the ruling, the question resolves as No.

title: Will Israel pass a groundbreaking cybersecurity law that becomes a model for other nations by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Israel has passed a cybersecurity law that is recognized as a model for other nations. The law must introduce significant innovations in cybersecurity practices, regulations, or technologies that are adopted or recommended for adoption by at least three other sovereign nations or international organizations. The adoption or recommendation for adoption must be documented by official government statements, international organization reports, or coverage in at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). The law must be fully enacted and in force, not merely proposed or in draft form. In the event of multiple cybersecurity laws being passed, the one with the most significant international influence as defined above will be considered for resolution.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency platform introduce a blockchain solution for tracking epidemic outbreaks by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major cryptocurrency platform has officially introduced a blockchain solution designed specifically for tracking epidemic outbreaks. A "major cryptocurrency platform" is defined as one that is listed in the top 10 by market capitalization according to CoinMarketCap or a similar authoritative cryptocurrency market analysis site at the time of the solution's announcement. The blockchain solution must be capable of tracking the spread of diseases, including but not limited to, data on infection rates, recovery rates, and mortality rates. The introduction of the solution must be confirmed by an official announcement from the platform or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The solution must be operational and available for use, not merely proposed or in a trial phase. In the event of a dispute over whether a platform is considered "major," the market capitalization rankings at the time of the solution's announcement will be the deciding factor.

title: Will Canada launch a national cryptocurrency by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Canada has officially launched a national cryptocurrency. The cryptocurrency must be recognized and regulated by the Canadian government as a legal tender for the country. The launch must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be operational and available for public use, not in a trial phase. In the event of a regional launch (e.g., limited to specific provinces or territories), the question will resolve as Yes if the cryptocurrency is intended for nationwide use.

title: Will a leading cryptocurrency exchange sponsor a Grand Slam tennis tournament by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a leading cryptocurrency exchange is officially announced as a sponsor of any of the four Grand Slam tennis tournaments (Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, or US Open). A "leading cryptocurrency exchange" is defined as one that is ranked within the top 10 by trading volume on sites like CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko at the time of the sponsorship announcement. The sponsorship must be confirmed through an official announcement by the Grand Slam tournament's organizing body or the cryptocurrency exchange. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The sponsorship must be for the main event, not subsidiary events or activities. In the event of multiple exchanges sponsoring different Grand Slam tournaments, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of the sponsorships meets these criteria.

title: Will DeepMind develop a model to accurately predict climate change impacts on global ecosystems by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, DeepMind has developed and publicly announced a model that can accurately predict the impacts of climate change on global ecosystems. The model must demonstrate a high degree of accuracy in predicting outcomes such as temperature changes, sea level rise, shifts in biodiversity, and changes in ecosystem services across multiple regions of the world. The accuracy of the model must be validated by independent scientific research or recognized by a leading scientific organization or journal. The development of the model must be confirmed through an official announcement by DeepMind or through publication in a reputable scientific journal. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. The model must be operational and available for use by the scientific community, not merely a theoretical or experimental project.

title: Will a significant breakthrough in virology lead to a novel method of combating plant diseases that threaten global food security by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant breakthrough in virology results in the development of a novel method for combating plant diseases that pose a threat to global food security. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or innovation that represents a substantial advancement in the understanding or treatment of plant diseases caused by viruses, leading to the development of a method that is demonstrably more effective than existing strategies. The novel method must be validated through peer-reviewed research and recognized by a leading agricultural or plant science institution. The breakthrough must be applicable on a scale that has the potential to materially improve global food security. In the event of multiple claims of breakthroughs, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the scientific community as reported by reputable scientific journals or organizations.

title: Will the next Olympics introduce a new category of eco-friendly sports to promote environmental awareness by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the International Olympic Committee (IOC) has officially introduced a new category of sports in the Olympic Games that is specifically designed to promote environmental awareness. The new category must include sports or events that are recognized for their eco-friendly practices or contribute to environmental conservation. The introduction of such a category must be confirmed through an official IOC announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The sports included in this new category must demonstrate a clear and direct contribution to environmental awareness or conservation, such as the use of sustainable materials, promotion of conservation efforts, or raising awareness about environmental issues through the sport's platform. Temporary or experimental events not intended for permanent inclusion in the Olympic Games do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the economic impact of baseball broadcasting rights see a significant change by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a significant change in the economic impact of baseball broadcasting rights, defined as:
- A change of more than 20% in the total value of Major League Baseball (MLB) broadcasting rights deals compared to 2023.
- The introduction of a new, major player in the broadcasting rights market that alters the competitive landscape.
- A substantial shift in the distribution model for MLB games, such as a move from traditional broadcasting to predominantly streaming platforms.

Significant change will be determined by financial reports from MLB, broadcasting rights agreements, or credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times, Wall Street Journal). In the absence of clear financial data, consensus among at least three reputable sports or financial news organizations will be sufficient.

In the event of a dispute over what constitutes a 'significant change,' the resolution will default to the most widely accepted interpretation among sports economists.

title: Will COVID-19 lead to a permanent increase in remote work within major economies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a statistically significant increase in the percentage of the workforce engaged in remote work, compared to pre-pandemic levels (2019), within at least three of the following major economies: United States, China, Japan, Germany, and the United Kingdom. The increase must be confirmed by labor statistics or reputable economic research from sources such as the Bureau of Labor Statistics, National Bureau of Statistics of China, Statistics Japan, Federal Statistical Office of Germany, or the Office for National Statistics in the United Kingdom. For the purpose of this question, 'remote work' is defined as employment where the majority of work tasks are performed outside of a traditional office environment, including work from home arrangements. The question will resolve as No if such an increase is not observed by the specified date. In the event of conflicting data, the consensus among these sources will be used to determine the outcome. Temporary shifts to remote work due to pandemic-related lockdowns or restrictions are not considered in determining a permanent increase.

title: Will a new infectious disease outbreak significantly impact global markets before 2030?
Will geopolitical tensions lead to the cancellation of a Major League Baseball season before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a Major League Baseball (MLB) season is officially cancelled due to geopolitical tensions. Geopolitical tensions are defined as conflicts between nations that significantly impact international relations and could include, but are not limited to, wars, significant economic sanctions, or major diplomatic disputes. The cancellation must be officially announced by Major League Baseball or its governing body and must explicitly cite geopolitical tensions as the primary reason for the cancellation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, The New York Times, BBC) confirming the cancellation due to geopolitical tensions will be sufficient for resolution. This question does not consider cancellations for other reasons, such as labor disputes, natural disasters, or pandemics.

title: Will the Republican Party (US) initiate a significant foreign policy shift that impacts global alliances before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Republican Party in the United States initiates a foreign policy shift that significantly impacts global alliances. A "significant foreign policy shift" is defined as any action, policy adoption, or official statement by the Republican Party or a Republican-led U.S. administration that leads to the formation of a new major alliance, the dissolution of an existing major alliance, or a substantial change in the terms or membership of an existing major alliance. The impact of the policy shift must be recognized and reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the consensus among these sources will be considered authoritative. Temporary or minor adjustments in foreign policy do not qualify as significant shifts for the purpose of this question.

title: Will Sweden host a major international summit aimed at resolving a significant geopolitical crisis before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Sweden officially hosts a major international summit aimed at resolving a significant geopolitical crisis. A "major international summit" is defined as a meeting that includes representatives from at least five countries, including at least three members of the United Nations Security Council. The summit must be focused on a "significant geopolitical crisis," which refers to conflicts or situations that have the potential to affect global stability, such as wars, large-scale territorial disputes, significant economic crises, or major environmental disasters. The hosting of the summit must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Swedish government or the United Nations. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. The summit must result in a publicly available declaration or agreement aimed at resolving the crisis. In the event of multiple summits, the question will resolve as Yes upon the hosting of the first summit that meets these criteria.

title: Will a member of the US House of Representatives switch to a third party by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, at least one current member of the US House of Representatives officially announces their switch from either the Democratic or Republican Party to a third party. The switch must be confirmed by an official statement from the representative or their office, and recognized by the Clerk of the House of Representatives. For the purpose of this question, a 'third party' is defined as any political party in the United States other than the Democratic or Republican Parties. This includes, but is not limited to, the Libertarian Party, Green Party, and any newly established parties that may arise. The resolution will rely on credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or official government announcements. In the event of a representative switching to independent status or no party affiliation, this will not satisfy the resolution criteria. The question resolves as No if no such switch is officially announced by the specified date.

title: Will SpaceX's Reusable Launch System be utilized for a government mission by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, SpaceX's Reusable Launch System (RLS) has been utilized for at least one mission commissioned by any government agency worldwide. The mission must be officially acknowledged by SpaceX and the contracting government agency. The RLS must complete the mission, including launch, mission objectives, and recovery, to be considered utilized. In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be sufficient for resolution. Missions solely for testing, demonstration, or non-operational purposes do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Germany hold a referendum on EU membership before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, Germany officially announces and holds a referendum on its membership in the European Union. The referendum must be a nationwide vote asking citizens to decide on continuing or ending Germany's EU membership. The announcement of the referendum must come from an official government source. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient for resolution. The question resolves as Yes only if the referendum is carried out and the results are officially published by the German government.

title: Will India lead the world in AI technology development by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, India is recognized as the global leader in the development of artificial intelligence technology. Leadership in AI technology development can be determined by one or more of the following criteria:

- India must be home to at least three of the top ten AI companies globally, as ranked by market capitalization or influential technology analysis firms.
- India must have published more peer-reviewed scientific papers on AI than any other country in the preceding five years, according to databases such as Scopus or Web of Science.
- India must have made a significant AI breakthrough that is widely recognized by the international scientific community, evidenced by awards or special recognition from reputable scientific organizations.

In the absence of clear market leadership, a consensus among experts in the field, as reported by reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or technology analysis firms, will be sufficient for resolution. The development of AI technology includes, but is not limited to, machine learning, natural language processing, robotics, and computer vision.

title: Will Norway implement a national AI strategy to become a leader in ethical AI by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Norway has officially implemented a national AI strategy aimed at establishing the country as a leader in ethical artificial intelligence. The strategy must include clear guidelines, policies, or initiatives focused on ethical considerations in AI development and application, such as transparency, fairness, privacy, and accountability. The implementation of the strategy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The strategy must be operational, with evidence of active initiatives or policies being applied. Temporary or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention deploy an AI system to predict and manage epidemics more effectively than current methods by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has officially deployed an artificial intelligence (AI) system designed to predict and manage epidemics more effectively than the methods used as of 2023. The effectiveness of the AI system must be demonstrated through:
- A significant reduction in response time to emerging health threats compared to 2023 standards.
- Improved accuracy in predicting epidemic outbreaks, as evidenced by peer-reviewed research or official CDC reports.
- Enhanced ability to manage and contain epidemic outbreaks, leading to measurable improvements in public health outcomes.

The deployment of such a system must be confirmed by an official CDC announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The AI system must be fully operational and utilized in real-world epidemic management, not in a trial phase.

metadata.tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Will the Democratic Party's policies lead to a significant increase in the US GDP growth rate by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States' Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate has increased significantly due to policies implemented by the Democratic Party. A "significant increase" is defined as a rise in the annual GDP growth rate of at least 1.5 percentage points above the average growth rate of the previous five years, as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA). The determination of whether the increase is attributable to Democratic Party policies will be based on analysis from at least three reputable economic research institutions or think tanks. In the absence of consensus among these sources, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, "policies implemented by the Democratic Party" refers to legislation, executive orders, and major regulatory changes enacted after January 20, 2021.

title: Will Elon Musk's companies collectively surpass a market capitalization of $2 trillion by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the combined market capitalization of all companies where Elon Musk holds a significant ownership interest (defined as more than 5% of the company) surpasses $2 trillion USD. Significant ownership interest must be maintained at least from the resolution date announcement until December 31, 2025, for a company to be considered part of this question. The market capitalization will be determined based on the closing stock prices on December 31, 2025, as reported by major financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. In the event of a private company valuation, the most recent valuation reported by credible financial news sources will be used. This question does not consider the effects of inflation, currency exchange rates, or other economic factors outside of market capitalization. In case of any mergers, acquisitions, or significant ownership changes involving Elon Musk's companies, the market capitalization will be adjusted accordingly to reflect the state of the companies at the resolution date. The resolution will be based on publicly available financial data and reports from the companies involved or their official announcements.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report a decrease in the national unemployment rate to below 3.5% by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) officially reports a national unemployment rate of below 3.5%. The reported rate must be for a standard monthly employment situation summary, not adjusted for seasonal variations. In the event of conflicting reports or revisions, the initial published rate for December 2025 will be considered definitive. Should the BLS cease to exist, be restructured, or its reporting methodologies fundamentally changed, the question will resolve based on the closest equivalent data from a federal government source. In the absence of reliable data, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Germany introduce a new digital privacy law that significantly impacts EU regulations before 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, Germany introduces a new digital privacy law that significantly impacts European Union (EU) regulations. 

Significant impact is defined as changes that require amendments to existing EU regulations, introduce new standards for data protection that exceed current EU norms, or necessitate adjustments in the digital operations of companies across multiple EU member states. 

The introduction of the law must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

In the event of a proposal without enactment, or if the law is introduced but does not significantly impact EU regulations as defined, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major international court rule that climate change denial is a form of hate speech by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major international court (such as the International Court of Justice, the European Court of Human Rights, or a similar level court) officially rules that climate change denial constitutes a form of hate speech. The ruling must be final and not subject to further appeal. For the purpose of this question, "climate change denial" is defined as the outright denial or unwarranted doubt of the consensus scientific view on climate change, including its extent, impact, or human causation. The resolution will rely on official court documents or announcements for verification. In the absence of such documents, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. This question does not consider rulings by national courts or lower-level international tribunals.

title: Will Mexico implement a groundbreaking legal framework for cryptocurrency regulation by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Mexico has officially implemented a legal framework for cryptocurrency regulation that is recognized as groundbreaking by the international financial community. Groundbreaking is defined as introducing significant innovations in regulation that go beyond current global standards, including but not limited to comprehensive consumer protection, anti-money laundering measures, and integration with traditional financial systems. The implementation of such a framework must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The framework must be fully operational and not merely proposed or in draft form. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific aspects of cryptocurrency regulation), the question will resolve as Yes if the implemented parts are considered groundbreaking on their own.

title: Will Canada introduce a digital currency regulated by its central bank by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Canada has officially introduced a digital currency that is regulated by the Bank of Canada. The introduction of such a currency must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Bank of Canada or the Canadian government. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (CBC, The Globe and Mail, National Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) are sufficient. The digital currency must be fully operational and available for use by the general public, not in a trial or pilot phase. In the event of a limited release (e.g., available only in certain provinces or for specific transactions), the question will resolve as Yes if there is a clear plan and timeline for nationwide availability. Temporary or experimental digital currency initiatives that do not lead to a permanent, publicly available currency do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Nations adopt a cryptocurrency as a standard for international trade by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United Nations (UN) has officially adopted a cryptocurrency as a standard for conducting international trade. The adoption must be formalized through an official UN resolution, agreement, or equivalent formal declaration, recognized and reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The cryptocurrency in question must be explicitly designated for use in international trade transactions between nations. In the event of the adoption of multiple cryptocurrencies for this purpose, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one cryptocurrency meets these criteria. The resolution will rely on public announcements or documentation from the UN or credible news reports. In the absence of such announcements, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Major League Baseball (MLB) experience a significant increase in global viewership by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Major League Baseball (MLB) experiences a significant increase in global viewership. A 'significant increase' is defined as a 20% or more rise in average global viewership numbers compared to the 2022 season, as reported by Nielsen or a similar authoritative sports analytics firm. The increase must be reflected across a full MLB season. Increases in viewership due to expansion teams, if any, are included. However, temporary spikes in viewership for specific events (e.g., World Series, All-Star Game) do not count towards this question's resolution. In the absence of direct data from Nielsen or equivalent, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient for resolution. The question will resolve as No if the criteria are not met by the specified date.

title: Will Russia face significant economic sanctions from the EU or US that impact its GDP by more than 5% before 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, Russia faces new economic sanctions from the European Union (EU) or the United States (US) that result in a reduction of Russia's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) by more than 5% within a 12-month period following the implementation of the sanctions.

The impact on Russia's GDP will be determined based on data and analysis from authoritative economic sources such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the World Bank, or national statistical agencies of the EU or US. In the absence of direct data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient.

Sanctions specifically targeting individuals or non-economic measures (e.g., travel bans, diplomatic expulsions) do not count towards this question's resolution. Only sanctions directly affecting the economic activities and financial transactions of Russia will be considered.

In the event of a dispute over the interpretation of economic data or the direct impact of sanctions, the consensus among the aforementioned authoritative sources will prevail.

title: Will a major breakthrough in biotechnology significantly impact the global economy before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major breakthrough in biotechnology is announced that significantly impacts the global economy. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or innovation in biotechnology that leads to a new product, therapy, or technology with the potential to change healthcare practices, agricultural productivity, environmental sustainability, or industrial processes on a global scale. The impact on the global economy must be confirmed by a GDP growth rate increase directly attributed to the biotechnology sector, as reported by the World Bank, IMF, or a similar authoritative economic body. In the absence of direct economic data, consensus among at least three major financial news outlets (Bloomberg, Financial Times, Reuters) that the breakthrough has had a significant economic impact will suffice. The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community, with publication in a peer-reviewed journal or endorsement by a leading scientific organization.

title: Will a cryptocurrency project aimed at combating climate change be launched by a major organization in the field of atmospheric science before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major organization in the field of atmospheric science launches a cryptocurrency project specifically aimed at combating climate change. A "major organization" is defined as an entity recognized globally for its contributions to atmospheric science, research, or policy development, such as the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF), or equivalent. The project must be aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions, promoting sustainable energy use, or supporting climate change mitigation or adaptation efforts. The launch of the project must be confirmed through an official announcement by the organization or coverage by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Projects in a pilot or trial phase are considered launched for the purpose of this question. In the event of ambiguity regarding the project's primary aim, the consensus of coverage by the specified news sources will determine its eligibility.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) propose legislation to regulate cryptocurrencies more strictly than current federal laws by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Democratic Party in the United States has officially proposed legislation aimed at regulating cryptocurrencies more strictly than the federal laws in effect as of December 31, 2023. The proposal must seek to impose tighter controls, increased transparency, or stricter enforcement mechanisms on the operation, trading, or use of cryptocurrencies. The legislation must be formally introduced in either the United States House of Representatives or the Senate. Confirmation of such a proposal can come from official government publications, announcements, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters). In the event that multiple pieces of legislation are proposed, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets the criteria outlined above. Proposals that are merely discussions or not formally introduced do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland become the first European country to officially adopt a cryptocurrency as legal tender by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Switzerland has officially adopted a cryptocurrency as legal tender, making it the first European country to do so. Legal tender is defined as money that must be accepted if offered in payment of a debt. The adoption must be confirmed through an official government announcement or legal documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be usable for all types of transactions within Switzerland, including but not limited to taxes, public services, and retail purchases. This question resolves as YES upon the official recognition of the cryptocurrency as legal tender by the Swiss government, otherwise, it resolves as NO.

title: Will Canada lead the world in a major technological innovation by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Canada is recognized as the leading nation in a major technological innovation. A "major technological innovation" is defined as a breakthrough that significantly advances the field of technology, has a global impact, and is widely adopted or acknowledged by the international community. The innovation must be attributed primarily to Canadian individuals, organizations, or companies. Recognition can come from international awards, patents filed and recognized internationally, or consensus among reputable technology news outlets and industry experts. The innovation must be new, originating no earlier than January 1, 2021. In the event of multiple countries claiming leadership in the same innovation, the resolution will consider the country that initiated the foundational research or development.

title: Will a significant technological breakthrough in baseball analytics be developed by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant technological breakthrough in baseball analytics is developed and publicly acknowledged. A "significant technological breakthrough" is defined as a development that substantially enhances the understanding, prediction, or analysis of baseball performance, strategies, or player health and is recognized as such by major baseball organizations (e.g., Major League Baseball (MLB), Nippon Professional Baseball (NPB), or the International Baseball Federation (IBAF)). The breakthrough must be documented in at least one of the following: an official press release from a major baseball organization, coverage in three or more reputable sports news outlets (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic), or publication in a peer-reviewed sports science journal. Developments that offer marginal improvements or are considered evolutionary rather than revolutionary do not qualify. The breakthrough must be new, not previously reported before 2023, and must be applicable in a practical, real-world baseball context.

title: Will a new form of cybersecurity emerge as a dominant force in information technology by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new form of cybersecurity (defined as a method, technology, or practice not widely used or recognized before 2023) has emerged and is recognized as a dominant force in the field of information technology. Dominance is defined as being adopted by at least 50% of Fortune 500 companies for their primary cybersecurity needs, or being the subject of at least 30% of cybersecurity-related academic publications in that year. Recognition of dominance must come from credible sources such as major cybersecurity firms, IT industry reports, or academic journals. The emergence of the new cybersecurity form must be confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or official industry reports. In the event that multiple new forms of cybersecurity emerge, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the criteria for dominance.

title: Will France commission a new nuclear power plant by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has officially commissioned a new nuclear power plant. Commissioning is defined as the process by which an equipment, facility, or plant (which is installed, or is complete or near completion) is tested to verify if it functions according to its design objectives or specifications. For the purposes of this question, a nuclear power plant must have begun supplying electricity to the national grid as a result of nuclear fission. The commissioning must be confirmed by an official announcement from the French government or the operating company. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of a delay in commissioning, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major soccer event be postponed or canceled due to a nuclear incident by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major soccer event (defined as the FIFA World Cup, UEFA European Championship, Copa América, or the Olympic Soccer Tournament) is officially postponed or canceled due to a nuclear incident. A "nuclear incident" refers to any event involving the release of significant radioactive materials, leading to public health or environmental hazards, as recognized by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) or a national nuclear regulatory body. The postponement or cancellation must be directly attributed to the nuclear incident by the organizing body or a government authority. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary delays or rescheduling within the same calendar year do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the World Health Organization issue new guidelines on nuclear radiation exposure by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the World Health Organization (WHO) has officially issued new guidelines regarding nuclear radiation exposure. The issuance of these guidelines must be documented through an official WHO publication or press release. In the absence of direct publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the release of new guidelines will be sufficient for resolution. The guidelines must specifically address changes or updates in the recommended safety measures, exposure limits, or health implications related to nuclear radiation. Interim advisories, preliminary reports, or updates to existing documents without substantial changes in recommendations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant philosophical shift in the approach to technology ethics by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant philosophical shift in the approach to technology ethics, characterized by the adoption of new ethical frameworks or principles that substantially alter the way technology is developed, deployed, and governed. This shift must be recognized by a consensus among leading technology ethicists, as evidenced by publications in major academic journals, position statements from professional societies in the fields of technology and ethics, or coverage in at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian). The shift must represent a departure from the ethical frameworks dominant as of 2023, and it must have a demonstrable impact on policy, industry practices, or public discourse. In the absence of clear consensus, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major technology company announce a significant advancement in election security technology before the 2024 US presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before November 3, 2024, a major technology company (defined as a company with a market capitalization of over $10 billion USD or a globally recognized brand in the technology sector) announces a significant advancement in election security technology. The advancement must be aimed at protecting the integrity of the electoral process, such as preventing hacking, ensuring voter privacy, or enhancing the reliability of vote counting. The announcement must be verifiable through an official press release or public statement by the company. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. The technology must be described as ready for deployment or in the process of being deployed, not merely in a conceptual or developmental stage. In the event of multiple companies announcing relevant advancements, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of the announcements meets these criteria.

title: Will a new technology significantly impact the way soccer is played or officiated by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new technology has been officially adopted and is in active use that significantly impacts the way soccer is played or officiated. Significant impact is defined as a change that affects the rules of the game, player performance, strategy, or the accuracy and efficiency of officiating. Examples include, but are not limited to, automated offside detection systems, performance-enhancing wearables, or advanced injury prevention technologies.

The adoption of the technology must be recognized by at least one of the following: FIFA, UEFA, or any national soccer federation participating in FIFA World Cup or UEFA European Championship. The technology must be used in official matches, not just trials, and its impact must be documented by reputable sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sky Sports, BBC Sport).

In the event that multiple technologies emerge, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria. Technologies introduced before 2023 but widely adopted or recognized for their impact after this date also qualify.

title: Will North Korea conduct a new type of nuclear test before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, North Korea conducts a nuclear test that is significantly different from its previous tests in terms of yield, method, or technology. Significant difference must be confirmed by official statements from at least two of the following: the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organization (CTBTO), the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), or national nuclear monitoring agencies of the United States, South Korea, or Japan. In the absence of official statements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. A new type of nuclear test refers to any test that introduces a new technology or methodology not previously used by North Korea in its nuclear program, including but not limited to thermonuclear devices, boosted fission devices, or novel delivery mechanisms. In the event of ambiguous evidence or claims, the question will resolve as No unless the aforementioned criteria are met. This question does not consider increases in yield alone as a new type of test unless accompanied by a new technology or methodology.
